Job Description
Job Description:
As part of a school curriculum in initial training, you are looking for a mandatory internship or integrated into a gap year, that will allow you to validate your studies. The internship duration is 4 to 6 months maximum.
We offer you to work in a world-leading company which is at the heart of a digital transformation, at the cutting edge of research and innovation.
We are looking for SUPPLIER SUPPORT MANAGEMENT CABIN (m/f) who will be joining us at Airbus site in Toulouse - Blagnac.
This internship is to be filled from January 2020 (the dates are subject to a certain flexibility)
You will be joining the department « Supplier Support Management Cabin » which activities include
Deployment of Supplier Support Contracts with cabin suppliers
Measuring and improving Supplier Support performances versus contractual agreements
Improvement of supplier performance by improvement plans and regular follow-up thereof
The objective of the internship is to support the deployment of the new standard of Supplier Support Contract with key cabin suppliers
Prepare mapping of current contractual set-up of Procurement Contracts and Supplier Support Conditions
Support exchange with Procurement Cabin regarding the future contracting strategy
Support to negotiation of customer support contracts
Preparation of contract validation forms (CDF) and contractual documents
Conduct analysis of work packages and contracts on commodity level (e.g. lavatories, Floor to Floor (F2F))
Prepare mapping of contractual set-up for the different commodities on work package level
Analysis of current contractual conditions and agreements (e.g. inconsistencies between procurement contracts and SSC, contract deviations)
Prepare recommendations and proposal of future set-up of SSC within a commodity
Tasks and Responsibilities :
You will be working under the supervision of your manager who will help you identify your professional objectives and support you in the development of your skills.
Throughout the lifecycle of our Aircraft programs from development to out of production phase, the jobholder leads Airbus' suppliers to ensure customer support expectations are met & exceeded through developing and implementing standards and policies & continuously improving support performance of the suppliers. Suppliers support management is covering spares availability, repair performance, reliability, maintenance costs, technical data, training & technical support. Suppliers scope covered include equipment and systems.
Your main activities will include:
1) Support the development and implementation of an Airbus supplier support related strategy to cope with market evolution, Airbus business objectives and airlines expectations for SFE suppliers.
2) Ensure that Airbus Suppliers develop, maintain or enhance the capability to support their products throughout the life of our aircraft programmes to customers' expectations.
3) Program development phase - Support the application of S requirements in the supplier selection phase ensuring that future support performance will be in-line with expectations.
4) The jobholder is representing Customer Services in Multi-Functional Teams (MFT). By delegation from Procurement, they are supporting buyers and/or supporting negotiation of Suppliers Support Conditions as part of the selection.
5) Aircraft in service phase:
Support the monitoring and analyses of supplier support performance. Support the Supplier Support Rating process as an undisputed recognized performance evaluation tool.
Support the identification and implementation of improvement (reactive) and development (proactive) actions with the suppliers to recover or develop product support level.
Ensure deployment of policies and standards and best practices as benchmark for the Industry with the Airbus internal suppliers
Required skills:
You are preparing a diploma level Bac +4 or Bac+5, in Studies of Engineering, Commercial or equivalent, and you obtain following competences:
English: Negotiation Level
French: Advanced level
A first experience in contract negotiation and contract management would be a plus
You are able to use proficiently such tools as Office Package and Google Suite.
Soft skills:
Rigorous, curious and autonomous
- Obtain good interpersonal and communication skills - negotiation skills
Assertiveness and good sense of diplomacy
Ability to deliver to fast changing requests
Ability to manage business relationships
Conflicts management skills and experience
Ascendancy and influence on others

Job Description
Job Description:
As part of a school curriculum in initial training, you are looking for a mandatory internship or integrated into a gap year that will allow you to validate your studies. The internship duration is 6 months maximum.
We offer you to work in a world-leading company which is at the heart of a digital transformation, at the cutting edge of research and innovation.
We are looking for an internship focussing on a PREDICTIVE MODEL ON AIRCRAFT STRUCTURE REPAIRS (m/f) who will be joining us at Airbus site in Toulouse - Blagnac.
This internship is to be filled from January 2020 (the dates are subject to a certain flexibility)
The mission of the Aircraft Embodiment Operation department (SOR) is to provide end to end solutions in aircraft maintenance, modification and repairs. Our vision is to offer our Worldwide Customers the competence, creativity and proximity of our people to add value to their operations.
In SOR organization, SORA department has the mission of:
¤ anticipating maintenance, modification and repair activities
¤ developing innovative & differentiating products & services to support them
¤ industrializing packaged end-to-end solutions, ready to operate, cost efficient to AIRBUS, value adding to Customers
In this context, the purpose of this internship is to build a model aimed at predicting threats that lead to the involvement of SOR.
Tasks and Responsibilities :
You will be working under the supervision of your manager who will help you identify your professional objectives and support you in the development of your skills.
Your main activities will include:
1 - Getting a precise picture of where, how, when Airbus fleet is operated.
2 - Extrapolating what are inherent criteria that may lead to potential maintenance, modifications or repairs such as:
Aircraft environment: climatic aggression, premature degradation, intense airport traffic, change of operators.
Aircraft operations & maintenance: Fleet flight cycles / flight hours accumulation, critical maintenance tasks (fatigue inspections)
3 - Identifying corresponding corrective actions leading to SOR involvement as repairs, maintenance, complex modifications, retrofit campaigns, cabin refurbishing.
4 - Quantifying risks of occurrence with regards to the characteristics of the fleet.
5 - Predicting the degree of SOR involvement in terms of means and resources over time
To achieve this objective, you will have to:
¤ Identify, create and use interfaces with existing data bases within and outside AIRBUS, existing tools and processes aiming at anticipating occurrences
¤ Create new data bases if needed
¤ Develop the predictive model and associated supporting IT tool

You are preparing a diploma level Bac +5, in Training General Engineer or equivalent, and you obtain following competences:
English: INTERMEDIATE
French: INTERMEDIATE

You have a good knowledge of mechanical and IT domains

date_publication:

Signaler cette offre d'emploi
description:
AIRBUS SAS
Airbus est un leader mondial de l'aéronautique, de l'espace et des services associés. En 2018, le groupe a publié un chiffre d'affaires de 64 milliards d'euros, avec un effectif d'environ 134 000 personnes. Airbus propose la famille d'avions de ligne la plus complète qui soit. Airbus est, en outre, le leader européen dans le domaine des avions de mission, de ravitaillement en vol, de combat, et de transport. Par ailleurs, l'entreprise est également un leader de l'industrie spatiale. Enfin, dans le domaine des hélicoptères, Airbus propose les solutions civiles et militaires les plus performantes au monde.

Nos équipes travaillent avec passion et détermination pour faire du monde un endroit plus connecté, plus sûr et plus intelligent. Fiers de notre travail, nous nous appuyons sur l'expertise et l'expérience de chacun pour atteindre l'excellence. Notre diversité et culture du travail en équipe nous poussent à accomplir l'extraordinaire - sur terre, dans le ciel et dans l'espace.
Description de l'offre
Descriptif du poste:
Et si VOTRE aventure commençait avec NOUS !
Dans le cadre d'un cursus scolaire en formation initiale, vous recherchez un stage obligatoire ou intégrer dans une année de césure, d'une durée allant de 4 à 6 mois maximum, vous permettant de valider votre année.
Nous vous proposons de travailler dans une entreprise leader mondial dans son domaine, tournée vers le digital, à la pointe de la recherche et de l’innovation.
Une offre de stage en Evaluation des données du coût du trafic de l'avion (h/f) vient de s'ouvrir au sein d’Airbus sur notre site de Toulouse - Blagnac.
Ce stage est à pourvoir à partir du mois de Février 2020 (date sujette à une certaine flexibilité).
Vous rejoindrez le département Solutions numériques qui a pour objectif de fournir des services aéronautiques intégrés de premier plan à l'échelle mondiale, de créer de la valeur et d'améliorer les performances des clients.
L'objectif du stage est de construire un tableau de bord interactif permettant d'évaluer rapidement la quantité de données sortantes d'un avion via ACARS.
Tâches et responsabilités :
Vous serez sous la responsabilité d’un manager qui vous aidera à identifier vos objectifs professionnels et vous soutiendra dans le développement de vos compétences.
Les aéronefs modernes recueillent une grande quantité de données pendant les opérations. Ces données sont une mine d'or mais doivent être traitées au sol et doivent donc être téléchargées au préalable à partir de l'avion.
Cela a un coût qui dépend d'un certain nombre de facteurs et Airbus aimerait laisser à la compagnie aérienne le soin d'optimiser ce coût. En effet, l'opérateur peut syntoniser plusieurs canaux et de multiples options qui décident comment récupérer les données jusqu'au sol. Par exemple, activer le réseau cellulaire pour les données non critiques, utiliser le réseau ACARS pour les messages urgents, n'émettre qu'une fraction des données, etc...
Ces configurations se font à bord de l'avion mais un modèle simple et indépendant peut être construit à partir de ces configurations. Si nous combinons ce modèle avec les connaissances actuelles des cas d'utilisation en service, nous sommes en mesure d'en estimer le coût.
Dans ce contexte, vos principales activités seront les suivantes :
Vous construirez ce modèle de configuration en interviewant plusieurs acteurs et recueillera des ensembles de données précieuses.
Vous mettrez ensuite en place une application web simple qui permet de personnaliser ce modèle à l'échelle d'une flotte complète et qui montre son effet sur le trafic sortant pour chaque canal de sortie (cellulaire, SATCOM...). Avec cette application, l'Airbus pourra essayer différentes combinaisons avec la compagnie aérienne, surveiller les coûts associés et laisser la compagnie aérienne décider de la configuration optimale de l'avion en fonction de sa politique de données.
Le stage sera également l'occasion d'utiliser la toute dernière plate-forme de données d'Airbus pour développer cette application.
Profil recherché et Compétences requises:
Vous préparez un diplôme de niveau Bac +5, en Formation Ingénieur Systèmes et Modélisation ou équivalent, et vous avez obtenu les compétences suivantes :
Anglais : Niveau avancé
Français : Niveau Avancé
Une maitrise des outils de développement de langage tels que Javascript et SQL
Une première expérience dans l’ingénierie des systèmes et de la modélisation
Une bonne connaissance en Big Data et de l’interface Homme-Machine
Une Connaissance de l’aéronautique serait un plus
Savoir-être :
- Rigoureux (se), curieux (se) et autonome
Doté (e) d’un sens relationnel et bonne capacité de communication
Aptitude d’analyse et de synthèse
et pourvu(e) d’esprit d’équipe.
Vous pourrez, selon les offres proposées, être amené(e) à vous déplacer.
Si votre profil retient notre attention, vous serez invité à réaliser un entretien vidéo au cours duquel vous aurez quelques minutes pour nous convaincre. Par la suite, votre candidature pourra être proposée aux managers.
Si la perspective de rejoindre notre Groupe innovant vous motive ?
N’hésitez pas ! Postulez en ligne ! www.airbus.com/careers

Ce poste exige une connaissance des risques potentiels de non-conformité. Le/la titulaire s’engage à agir avec intégrité, fondement du succès, de la réputation et de la croissance durable de la Société.

En soumettant votre CV ou votre candidature, vous autorisez Airbus à utiliser et stocker des informations vous concernant à des fins de suivi de votre candidature ou de futurs emplois. Ces informations ne seront utilisées que par Airbus.
Airbus s’engage pour la Diversité. Nous encourageons toutes les candidatures indépendamment de l’origine sociale et culturelle, de l’âge, du genre, du handicap, de l’orientation sexuelle ou des croyances religieuses.

EUMETSAT - France
titre_poste: REQUIREMENTS ENGINEERING MANAGER, based in Darmstadt, Germany

Signaler cette offre d'emploi
description:
Within the Ground Segment System Engineering (GSSE) Competence Area of the System Engineering and Projects (SEP) Division, the Requirements Engineering Manager will be responsible for managing the Requirements and Verification Engineering processes and activities aimed at developing, maintaining and evolving ground segments for satellite systems exploited by EUMETSAT.
DUTIES
Coordinate the implementation of the process and related practices for requirements and verification engineering;
Manage and develop a team of engineers supported by contracted services to ensure continuity of the requirements engineering support to the organisation;
Coordinate or participate in selected Requirements Engineering activities in support to projects or programmes;
Assess the maturity of the requirements and verification engineering processes in EUMETSAT and derive the necessary evolutions according to industry standards;
Develop, communicate, implement and maintain a roadmap for planned evolutions of requirements and verification engineering management.
SKILLS AND EXPERIENCE
Proven theoretical and practical experience as Requirements Engineering and/or Verification Engineering responsible;
Strong planning, analysis and presentation skills, coupled with excellent interpersonal skills and proven experience working as part of a team;
Initial experience in leading or coordinating an engineering team preferably in the area of requirements management and/or verification activities;
Experience in using and customising Requirements Management tools (preferred IBM DOORS);
Relevant certification in Requirements or/and Verification Engineering, e.g. IREB CPRE, ISTQB Foundation, or INCOSE CSEP is advantageous.
Model Based Systems Engineering knowledge would be desirable.
University Degree (or equivalent) in a relevant technical discipline;
Candidates must be able to work effectively in English and have some knowledge of French.
EMPLOYMENT CONDITIONS
The initial contract will be of 4 years’ duration, with subsequent 5-year contracts being awarded thereafter, subject to individual performance and organisation requirements. There is no limit to the amount of follow-up contracts a staff member can receive up to the EUMETSAT retirement age of 63 and there are certainly opportunities to establish a long career perspective at EUMETSAT.
This post is graded A3/A4 on the EUMETSAT salary scales. The minimum basic salary for this post is EURO 6,925 per month (net of internal tax) which may be negotiable based on skills and experience. The salary scale provides for increments on the anniversary of taking up employment, and scales are reviewed by the EUMETSAT Council with effect from 1 January each year. In addition to basic salary, EUMETSAT offers attractive benefits. Further information, including salary details, is available on the EUMETSAT web site.
EUMETSAT is committed to providing an equal opportunity work environment.
Please note that only nationals of EUMETSAT Member States may apply. The EUMETSAT Convention requires that Staff shall be recruited based on their qualifications, account being taken of the international character of EUMETSAT.
ABOUT EUMETSAT
EUMETSAT is Europe’s meteorological satellite agency. Its role is to establish and operate meteorological satellites to monitor the weather and climate from space - 24 hours a day, 365 days a year. This information is supplied to the National Meteorological Services of the organisation's Member and Cooperating States in Europe, as well as other users worldwide.
EUMETSAT also operates several Copernicus missions on behalf of the European Union and provide data services to the Copernicus marine and atmospheric services and their users.
As an intergovernmental European Organisation, EUMETSAT has 30 Member States (Austria, Belgium, Bulgaria, Croatia, Czech Republic, Denmark, Estonia, Finland, France, Germany, Greece, Hungary, Iceland, Ireland, Italy, Latvia, Lithuania, Luxembourg, The Netherlands, Norway, Poland, Portugal, Romania, Slovakia, Slovenia, Spain, Sweden, Switzerland, Turkey and the United Kingdom).
Closing Date 11th October 2019

Job Types: Full-time, Permanent
Salary: 83,100.00€ /year
Language:
English (Preferred)
French (Preferred)

We’re an international software company at the forefront of imagining the future of digital security. Avira’s award-winning products and technology protect over 500 million users in the connected world.

What makes us special? First and foremost – it’s the authentic people at Avira.
We have a great community feeling that fosters your uniqueness and offers the space to reflect, the feedback to grow, and the freedom to innovate. If you are looking for a culture that also encourages aspiration and professional excellence get in touch with us and discover the Avira experience first-hand.

The Challenge:
You will join at a very interesting moment since we are completely rebuilding the look and feel of the Avira products on Windows. Instead of having many separate products installed, in the future, we will offer a well-integrated solution with a unique user experience. You will work closely together with other developers to define the architecture of the new solution, implement functionality using the latest methodologies, write automated tests, analyze customer data and run experiments. You will keep a good connection to other people around the agile development team, like Product Manager, Designers and Data Analyst to influence possible future features.

The Team:
We are an agile development team with experienced software engineers which is part of the Windows Consumer Suites business unit. Our unit develops and markets Avira’s core offerings on the Windows platform. We are a cross-functional unit of 30 passionate people and are responsible for Avira Free Security, Avira Prime, Avira Internet Security and Avira Optimization Suite.

What you will do:
With your expertise, you will exert a strong influence on decisions, methods of approach, and results in the team. You will lay the technological foundation for the global success of our products, collaborate with the Product Owner to find the best technical solutions and give feedback about the technical feasibility of new feature requests. Furthermore, you will develop high-quality and highly-secure software using modern methods in C#, while working in an agile scrum team to leverage the power of a self-responsible and multi-skilled team is something you favor.

AIRBUS SAS
Airbus is a global leader in aeronautics, space and related services. In 2018 it generated revenues of € 64 billion and employed a workforce of around 134,000. Job Description
Job Description:
As part of a school curriculum in initial training, you are looking for a mandatory internship or integrated into a gap year, that will allow you to validate your studies. The internship duration is 4 to 6 months maximum.
We offer you to work in a world-leading company which is at the heart of a digital transformation, at the cutting edge of research and innovation.
We are looking for a motivated individual for an internship in Evaluation of the aircraft data traffic's cost (m/f) who will be joining us at Airbus site in Toulouse - Blagnac.
This internship is to be filled from February 2020 (the dates are subject to a certain flexibility)
You will join the Digital Solutions department which aims at delivering world leading integrated aviation services, creating value and enhancing customer performance.
The objective of the internship is to build an interactive dashboard that allows to quickly evaluate the amount of data going out of an aircraft through ACARS.
Tasks and Responsibilities :
You will be working under the supervision of your manager who will help you identify your professional objectives and support you in the development of your skills.
Modern aircraft are collecting a large amount of data during operations. Those data are a gold mine but should be processed on the ground and therefore require to be downloaded from the aircraft first.
This has a cost depending on a various amount of factors and Airbus would like to let the airline optimize this cost. Indeed the operator can tune multiple channels and multiple options that decide how to retrieve data down to the ground. For instance activate cellular network for non critical data, use ACARS network for time critical messages, emit only a fraction of the data, etc...
Those configurations are done on board the aircraft but a simple independent model can be built out of them. If we combine this model with the current knowledge of in service use cases then we are able to approximate a cost.
Your main activities will include:
You will build this configuration model by interviewing multiple actors and gather valuable datasets.
The intern will then set up a simple web application that allows to customize this model on the scale of a full fleet and that shows its effect on the outgoing traffic for each output channel (cellular, SATCOM...). With this app the Airbus will be able to try different combinations with the airline, watch the associated costs and let the airline decide what should be the optimal aircraft configuration depending on its data policy.
The internship will also be the opportunity to use the newest Airbus big data platform to develop this app.
Required skills:
You are preparing a diploma level Bac +5, in Engineer training as a Systems and Modelling or equivalent, and you obtained the following competences:
English: Advance Level
French: Advance Level
Interpersonal skills System engineering and modelling
Knowledge in Big data
Knowledge in Human Machine Interface
Being familiar with aeronautics will be a plus
You are able to use proficiently such tools as development language (javascript and SQL)
Soft skills:
You are curious and autonomous
You have good interpersonal and communication skills
You like to be a team player
You are able to analyze and synthesize information
Depending on the specifics of the offer, you may have to travel to other locations.
If your profile catches our attention, you will be invited to perform a video interview during which you will have a few minutes to tell us about your background, motivations and your professional project. Afterwards, your application could be proposed to the managers for further review.

Job Description
Job Description:
As part of a school curriculum in initial training, you are looking for a mandatory internship or integrated into a gap year, that will allow you to validate your studies. The internship duration is 6 months maximum.
We offer you to work in a world-leading company which is at the heart of a digital transformation, at the cutting edge of research and innovation.
We are looking for SUPPLIER SUPPORT MANAGER (m/f) who will be joining us at Airbus site in Toulouse - Blagnac.
This internship is to be filled from January 2020 (the dates are subject to a certain flexibility)
You will be joining the department « Aftermarket: Supplier Support Management ».
Throughout the lifecycle of our Aircraft programs from development to out of production phase, the Supplier Support Manager leads Airbus' suppliers to ensure customer support expectations are met & exceeded through developing and implementing standards and policies & continuously improving support performance of the suppliers. Suppliers support management is covering spares availability, repair performance, reliability, maintenance costs, technical data, training & technical support. Suppliers scope covered include equipment and systems.
The objective of the internship will be support a Supplier Support Manager in his/her daily activities and contribute to projects to continuously improve our ways of working.
Tasks and Responsibilities :
You will be working under the responsibility of one or two supplier support managers (SSM) who will help you identify your professional objectives and support you in the development of your skills.
You will support the SSM in their activities:
1) Develop and implement, in cooperation with Procurement, an Airbus supplier support related strategy to cope with market evolution, Airbus business objectives and airlines expectations for SFE suppliers.
2) Represent S at Executive meetings with suppliers in order to get suppliers commitments on resolution or improvement actions related to Customer Services and suppliers support performance related issues; provide full visibility to Airbus management on suppliers support performance.
3) Ensure that Airbus Suppliers develop, maintain or enhance the capability to support their products throughout the life of our aircraft programmes to customers' expectations.
4) Program development phase - Coordinating and securing S requirements in the supplier selection phase ensuring that future support performance will be fulfilling expectations. On SBP delegation, the jobholder is representing S at the Procurement Steering Committee for selection process with a veto right. The jobholder is representing Customer Services in Multi Functional Teams. By delegation from Procurement, they are supporting buyers or leading negotiation of suppliers support conditions (GCP, SSC, FHS, RSA) as part of the selection.
5) Aircraft sales phase - Ensure suppliers commitments when specific support conditions or services are requested as part of the sales campaign. Contribute to the financial objectives of the company in pushing the suppliers to participate actively to the sales campaign. Enhance marketability of our aircraft by demonstrating the competitiveness of the airbus suppliers.
6) Aircraft Entry Into Service - Ensure a smooth Entry Into Service for new products through audits/ assessments visits at the suppliers and ensure that the supplier support (availability of spares and tools, repair capabilities, organization, enhanced support with deployment of field specialists) have been put in place and are operational.
7) Aircraft in service phase: · Monitor and analyse suppliers support performance. Manage the Rating process with the rated suppliers as an undisputed recognized performance evaluation tool. · Identify and implement improvement (reactive) and development (proactive) actions with the suppliers to recover or develop the "first class" Product support level. · Ensure deployment of policies and standards and best practices as benchmark for the Industry with the Airbus internal suppliers
8) Program out of production phase - defining the long term support policy with suppliers and the support part of the obsolescence policy.
MAJOR END RESULTS:
A supplier community meeting their supplier support contractual obligations, with reliable, long term plans to assure future service levels.
Reliable supplier support monitoring system, enabling direct comparison of performance, enforcement of GCP obligations and identification of improvement plans by Airbus and the Customer community.
Supplier Improvement or Development program enforcement with those suppliers who fail to meet their obligations.
Efficient support of Airbus aircraft sales with spares and trade-off studies and models of provisioning during sales campaigns.
Sustained business model, workload model and performance monitoring process as the basis to fulfill agreed Profit and Loss Accountability Overall objectives are to ensure that Airbus is continuously recognized by the market as Number One in the way it manages its suppliers.
The Supplier Support Manager operates in a transfunctional and international network

English: Negotiation Level
French: Advance Level
You are Problem solving mindset
You have a good knowledge in supply chain management
You are able to use proficiently such tools as Microsoft and Google Suite pack

Job Description

What if YOU starts your journey with US!
As part of a school curriculum in initial training, you are looking for a mandatory internship or integrated into a gap year, that will allow you to validate your studies. The internship duration is 4 to 6 months maximum.
We offer you to work in a world-leading company which is at the heart of a digital transformation, at the cutting edge of research and innovation.
We are looking for DELAY COST FOR AIRLINES (m/f) who will be joining us at Airbus site in Toulouse - Blagnac.
This internship is to be filled from January 2020 (the dates are subject to a certain flexibility)
You will be joining the department « In-Service Aircraft Fleet Performance » in charge of optimizing the technical and economic performance of Airbus in-service fleet in the areas of operational reliability, aircraft availability, maintenance economics and fuel efficiency.
Tasks and Responsibilities :
You will be working under the supervision of your manager who will help you identify your professional objectives and support you in the development of your skills.
Your mission will be to investigate, define and analyse several cost drivers to adequately reflect the cost impact of operational interruptions for an airline and to carry out an analysis to estimate the relationships among the different variables of the current Operational Interruption Cost Model.
More precisely, you will develop a model to evaluate the “knock-on” effect cost of a delay, which consist in evaluating the cost for an airline of all consequential delays that are induced through the rest of the day by the initial delay.
Your main activities will include:
Identifying, retrieving and analysing the correct source of data
Proposing a mathematical model fitting with collected data
Implementing Knock-On cost effect in the current Airbus Operational Interruptions Cost Model.
Required skills:
You are preparing a diploma level Bac +4 or Bac +5, in Training General Engineer or equivalent, and you obtain following competences:
English: Negotiation Level
French: Advance Level
Interested by Airline’s organisation and Economics
A first experience in programming would be a plus

Description of the job
Are you convinced that Data Governance and Systems Compliance are a key to our Company future, experienced in Finance data model, flows and convinced by the business added value of the digitalization?
A Finance Data Governance & Systems Compliance organization supporting all divisions has open positions within Financial Systems .

As Systems Compliance Expert, Its role will be to ensure the deployment of Systems Controls over the Group, the maintenance of the referential in relationship with Finance stakeholders and external auditors, the follow-up of the governance and run mode in place to secure their application.
You will be exposed to current cutting-edge tools and innovative data and risk & compliance-related projects within and outside Finance functions in an agile environment.

Act as primary Subject Matter Expert for Data data-related functional questions and usage data content, authoritative source, usage consistency…

Support the Validation and prioritization data-related evolution in relation with business, sponsorship and IT
Apply and Participate in the definition of the rules for Data access, Data Lifecycle, Data Security and risks strategy (Delivering in particular data classification, risk assessment and risk elimination/mitigation). Produce, update, and publish high level Data Objects dictionary and Data Model.
Establish Data Cleansing Strategy, follow up cleansing execution and monitor Data Quality targets
Launch audits on existing solutions and be proactive on challenges & corrections to bring upon.
Manage and drive Communication and awareness on Finance Data Governance in the Group
Regarding Systems Compliance:
Contribute to System Controls Compliance
Contribute to the maintenance of the System Controls Framework and its deployment in the Group
Support System Audits (performed by Internal or External Auditors)
Manage and drive System Controls (ad-hoc reviews)
Manage and Drive communication and awareness on System Controls in the Group
For all activities:
Lead external support to achieve the missions
Coordinate and lead multi functional team in dedicated projects
Position is based in Toulouse. It may require some travels for business in Europe.

Master Degree in Finance
Experience in Controlling / Audit

SAP Knowledge (High level understanding of the data flows, structure in SAP)
Finance Reporting Systems (Understanding of the Key Management and Statutory Finance Reporting Systems)

description:
AIRBUS SAS
Airbus est un leader mondial de l'aéronautique, de l'espace et des services associés. En 2018, le groupe a publié un chiffre d'affaires de 64 milliards d'euros, avec un effectif d'environ 134 000 personnes. Airbus propose la famille d'avions de ligne la plus complète qui soit. Airbus est, en outre, le leader européen dans le domaine des avions de mission, de ravitaillement en vol, de combat, et de transport. Par ailleurs, l'entreprise est également un leader de l'industrie spatiale. Enfin, dans le domaine des hélicoptères, Airbus propose les solutions civiles et militaires les plus performantes au monde.

Nos équipes travaillent avec passion et détermination pour faire du monde un endroit plus connecté, plus sûr et plus intelligent. Fiers de notre travail, nous nous appuyons sur l'expertise et l'expérience de chacun pour atteindre l'excellence. Notre diversité et culture du travail en équipe nous poussent à accomplir l'extraordinaire - sur terre, dans le ciel et dans l'espace.
Description de l'offre
Et si VOTRE aventure commençait avec NOUS !
Dans le cadre d'un cursus scolaire en formation initiale, vous recherchez un stage obligatoire ou intégrer dans une année de césure, d'une durée de 6 mois maximum, vous permettant de valider votre année.
Nous vous proposons de travailler dans une entreprise leader mondial dans son domaine, tournée vers le digital, à la pointe de la recherche et de l’innovation.
Une offre de stage en INGENIEUR TECH DATA (h/f) vient de s'ouvrir au sein d’Airbus sur notre site de Toulouse – Colomiers/Guynemer.
Ce stage est à pourvoir en Février 2020 (date sujette à une certaine flexibilité)
Vous rejoindrez le département « Technical Data Structure » en charge du Support Client au sein de la Technical Data pour plusieurs missions nécessitant l'autonomie et la compétence technique générale d'un(e) futur(e) ingénieur.
Au jour le jour il/elle rédige et valide les produits de données techniques (manuel de maintenance, manuel de réparation, catalogue de pièces…) en conformité avec les normes internationales, pour permettre une maintenance et une exploitation sûres et efficaces des appareils et respecter les engagements contractuels.
Tâches et responsabilités :
Vous serez sous la responsabilité d’un manager qui vous aidera à identifier vos objectifs professionnels et vous soutiendra dans le développement de vos compétences.
Vous serez amenés à participer aux activités principales liées aux données techniques, y compris la rédaction, la vérification et la validation, la gestion de la sous-traitance et le support client. Assure l'analyse et l'intégration des critères de conception ayant un impact sur les produits de données techniques. Propose des améliorations pour les outils informatiques et les processus.
Dans ce contexte, vos 3 principales activités seront les suivantes :
Revue complète des références zonales, des procédures d'étiquette et de marquage avion pour le manuel de maintenance (AMM) :
Revue & harmonisation des procédures d'étiquette et de marquage avion pour le manuel de maintenance (AMM) pour tous les programmes Airbus :
Etablir une cartographie des procédures existantes des différents programmes avions (AMM ATA 11)
Rassembler les procédures existantes des différents programmes avions
Identifier les différences entre les programmes avions
Décider d'une solution harmonisée pour tous les programmes avions
Soumettre les maquettes au Bureau d'Etude pour approbation (pour les procédures modifiées)
Participer aux réunions avec le Bureau d'Etudes
Mettre à jour les maquettes avec les commentaires du Bureau d'Etudes
Sue la base de ces maquettes lancer et suivre les activités de la sous-traitance pour la rédaction finale.
Réaliser les nouvelles procédures de pose/dépose des étiquettes RFID (Radio Frequency IDentification) pour les avions Airbus
Analyser la base de données Technical Data des zones et des panneaux d’accès avion et identifier les informations manquantes par rapport aux données sources bureau d’études.
Lancer et piloter les actions correctives en sous-traitance et assurer le contrôle qualité.
Cette activité inclue l’organisation de réunions ainsi que l’écriture de comptes rendus le tout dans un environnement transnational.
Développement d'un démonstrateur innovant (basé sur 3DEx) pour naviguer dans le SRM Ident (identification des pièces du Structural Repair Manual) :
S'intégrer dans l'équipe projet NIS (Nacelle Innovative Solution)
Participer à l'architecture produit données techniques
Etablir des Use Cases de navigation dans la maquette 3D et d'évolution de configuration en service
Participer à la conception d'un démonstrateur
Valider le concept et le soumettre en CCB (Configuration Control Board)
Analyse de l'évolution de complexité de la donnée technique de maintenance au sein du département Structure :
En collaboration avec les équipes de production et data mining ainsi que les équipes future projets
Définir une série de données et critères de complexité associés
Obtenir un fond de données représentatif (Big Data) sur plateforme adéquate (ex. Hadoop)
Mener des analyses dans cette donnée pour déterminer les axes dominants de complexité
Comparer cette vue avec la configuration associée.
Profil recherché et Compétences requises:
Vous préparez un diplôme de niveau Bac +5, en Ingénierie Mécanique/ Maintenance Aéronautique ou équivalent, et vous avez les compétences suivantes :
Anglais : AVANCE
Français : NEGOCIATION
Une première expérience de gestion de projet et/ou de design technique sous-traité
Un vif intérêt pour l’aéronautique, les démarche d’industrialisation des processus et la digitalisation
Connaissance du génie mécanique
Une maitrise des outils tels que CATIA ou Python
Rigoureux (se), curieux (se) et autonome
Capacité d'intégration dans une équipe et souplesse d'adaptation
Reconnu(e) pour vos qualités d’organisation
Aptitude d’analyse et de synthèse
et pourvu(e) d’esprit d’équipe.
Vous pourrez, selon les offres proposées, être amené(e) à vous déplacer.
Si votre profil retient notre attention, vous serez invité à réaliser un entretien vidéo au cours duquel vous aurez quelques minutes pour nous convaincre. Par la suite, votre candidature pourra être proposée aux managers.

Ce poste exige une connaissance des risques potentiels de non-conformité. Le/la titulaire s’engage à agir avec intégrité, fondement du succès, de la réputation et de la croissance durable de la Société.

En soumettant votre CV ou votre candidature, vous autorisez Airbus à utiliser et stocker des informations vous concernant à des fins de suivi de votre candidature ou de futurs emplois. Ces informations ne seront utilisées que par Airbus.
Airbus s’engage pour la Diversité. Nous encourageons toutes les candidatures indépendamment de l’origine sociale et culturelle, de l’âge, du genre, du handicap, de l’orientation sexuelle ou des croyances religieuses.

titre_poste: Directeur marketing et commercial - Key Sales Manager (IoT) F/H

description:
Directeur marketing et commercial - Key Sales Manager – IoT Valley Toulouse
Notre Client, l'IoT Valley, est un écosystème de startups référent dans l’exploitation des objets connectés et de leurs datas en Europe.Au sud de Toulouse, une équipe de 40 personnes apportent au quotidien un maximum de valeur aux startups pour qu’elles atteignent rapidement une croissance exponentielle et répondent aux problèmes qu’elles souhaitent adresser. Pour cela L’IoT Valley va au-devant des clients, ETI ou grands comptes de l’industrie et des services, pour proposer des missions de conseil en innovation. La finalité des missions de conseil produites par les chefs de projets est de réduire les coûts, améliorer la performance opérationnelle et créer de nouveaux services.L’IoT Valley mobilise des ressources propres pour délivrer un conseil opérationnel, de l’audit d’étonnement au projet de déploiement de solutions à destination du manufacturing, des building systems ou de la supply chain. Les missions vont de plusieurs dizaines à quelques centaines de K€ avec un taux de récurrence élevé.
Pourquoi rejoindre l’IoT Valley ?
S’investir dans le projet de l’IoT Valley c’est vouloir travailler de façon innovante dans une univers de création de service et d’innovations technologiques.C’est surtout améliorer en permanence sa façon de voir les choses et pour les faire, construire collectivement des solutions et ne pas sentir de barrière à son propre fonctionnement. L’IoT Valley donne à tous ses collaborateurs comme à ses startup les moyens de signer des missions très ‘touchy’, de réaliser des contrats très ambitieux, d’envisager des solutions imaginatives où les moyens du client sont la seule limite.
Bosser et faire grandir l’IoT Valley
Manager les sales de l’IoT Valley c’est exercer son métier dans une sorte de laboratoire dans les rapports humains, dans les méthodes et dans les services vendus.
La création du service est récente, il s’agira de le structurer, de l’étoffer, de trouver les métriques, de donner du rythme et finalement de booster les ventes.
Avant tout il faudra définir, avec le CEO et la KAM, les fondamentaux, objectifs, stratégie commerciale et portefeuille produit.
Les missions à court terme, en collaboration avec la KAM sont :
Poser à plat l'ensemble du process de vente / le challenger,
Organiser, piloter l’activité de prospection de l'équipe
Organiser, structurer, piloter l’upsell en collaboration avec la KAM
Mettre en place le reporting des équipes de sales, piloter le variable
Recruter 2 Sales Rep. ,
Le profil du futur KSM
Le KSM est avant tout un manager, celui qui organise, oriente et facilite le travail des Sales Rep., qui les conduit collectivement au succès en les stimulant, en les formant et en les accompagnant. Par ses qualités d’analyse et d’organisation, il développe desstratégies etfait appliquer des méthodes de chasse et de pénétration de comptes.Par sa vision globale de l’entreprise, Il est déterminant dans le closing. Pour réussir il s’appuiera sur une expérience réussie dans la vente de services auprès de dirigeants, idéalement du conseil autour de l’innovation.
Au sujet du process de recrutement
- Pour donner une meilleure chance à votre candidature, étudiez le projet et motivez votre démarche par écrit.
- Les candidatures en ligne avec les attentes du client recevront un descriptif de poste plus complet, en même temps qu’un lien pour remplir un questionnaire en ligne.
- Les premiers et deuxième entretien seront conduits par le cabinet. Le premier par Skype le deuxième en présentiel. Il comprendra un assesment, un entretien sur la carrière et les compétences acquises, un entretien sur les motivations et objectifs de carrière.
Type d'emploi : CDI
Expérience:
directeur marketing et commercial - key sales (iot, consulting, france) f/h ou similaire: 5 ans (Souhaité)

You will be working under the supervision of your manager who will help you identify your professional objectives and support you in the development of your skills.
The purpose of this internship is to contribute to the establishment of the generic Systems Engineering assets to apply on Aircraft Development Programs, such as:
Participate to the improvement of the existing generic referential of Aircraft Operations, Functions, Requirements, Trade Offs and Architecture parameters, including the links between those assets.
Contribute to identification of improvement of the capabilities (tools and methods) supporting the definition and management of the generic Systems Engineering assets.
Assess approaches and solutions to build or complete Model Based Systems Engineering (MBSE) models
Analyse methodologies used on practical cases of multi-system functions under development
Identify proposals to reconcile different needs into a harmonized approach to multi-system functions
Make recommendations on processes to formally develop these functions, including in the context of MBSE (Aircraft performance, flight physics, Cockpit Display, Flight Control)
Required skills
You are preparing a degree ranging from the A level + 3 to the Master level, in General Engineering or Aeronautics with a specialization in Systems and you have an advanced level in French and English.
You have more specific skills for:
Advanced knowledge in Big Data, MBSE and VBA,
Advanced knowledge in systems engineering processes and methods such as ISO/IEEE 15288 a plus
Basic knowledge in systems engineering languages and tools such as:
DOORS,
Cameo System Modeler,
Enterprise Architect,
Rhapsody,
MEGA,
Matlab/Simulink,
SysML, UML, UAF,
Java, Java Script and Python
Your Mission, if you accept it, will ask you to be:
Rigorous , curious and self-contained
With a sense of relational skills
Recognized for your organizational qualities
Able to analyze and synthesize
Provided team spirit.
Finally, knowledge of project management would be a plus.
Depending on the specifics of the offer, you may have to travel to another locations.
If your profile catches our attention, you will be invited to perform a video interview during which you will have a few minutes to tell us about your background, motivations and your professional project. Afterwards, your application could be proposed to the managers for further review.
If the prospect of joining our innovative Group motivates you do not hesitate and apply online on our website www.airbus.com/careers!

description:
Fondé en 1981, ATR est devenu le leader mondial sur le marché des avions régionaux jusqu'à 90 places. Depuis sa création, ATR a vendu plus de 1 500 avions, exploités par plus de 200 opérateurs dans plus de 100 pays. Les ATR ont cumulé plus de 28 millions de vol. ATR est un partenariat conjoint entre deux acteurs majeurs européens de l'aéronautique : Airbus Group et Leonardo. Le siège social d'ATR se situe à Toulouse. ATR est certifié ISO 14001, la norme de référence internationale dans le domaine du respect de l'environnement.

ATR renforce son équipe en charge des couts de maintenance dans le but d'améliorer son programme de réduction des DMC (Couts de maintenance directs) et de renforcer la compétitivité d'ATR sur le marché des avions régionaux. Cette position est basée sur Toulouse au sein de la Direction Programme.
ATR recherche une personne qui contribuera activement à l'amélioration des DMC en mettant en place les procédures et les outils de mesure et d'analyse des couts de maintenance.
Ces outils permettront à toute l'équipe des couts de maintenance d'identifier ensemble les axes d'amélioration et de déployer une stratégie au niveau du Programme qui fournira les solutions en temps, dans le budget et à la qualité requis.
D'autre part, la personne déterminera et mettra en place des actions/solutions dans le domaine de la maintenance prédictive et corrective sur la configuration actuelle de l'avion mais aussi sur les configurations futures, dans le but de réduire les coûts de maintenance mais aussi d'améliorer la disponibilité opérationnelle de l'avion. La personne sera en charge :
Phase Mesure et Analyse:
o Développer une architecture IT pour le traitement des données de maintenance programmées/non programmées dans le but de supporter la campagne d'évolution MRBR et la customisation du programme de maintenance.
o Développer des méthodes et outils pour surveiller les temps et le coût associés aux taches de maintenance correctives , avec l'objectif d'identifier les améliorations les plus appropriées.
o Analyser les données de maintenance ( ex : rapport des données DMC, factures, rapport d'expertise) pour mettre à jour en continu la base de référence des couts de maintenance d'ATR
Phase Amélioration :
o Rechercher les domaines et applications possibles de la maintenance prédictive, sur l'architecture avion actuelle et avec les données avion disponibles.
o Développer une politique de ‘soft time' à appliquer aux composants de l'avion qui sont les principaux contributeurs de couts de maintenance, pour convertir des activités de maintenance non programmés en activités programmées et ainsi réduire les couts.
Des déplacements chez les compagnies aériennes seront nécessaires pour mener à bien ces activités.

Ce poste exige une connaissance des risques potentiels de non-conformité. Le/la titulaire s'engage à agir avec intégrité, fondement du succès, de la réputation et de la croissance durable de la Société.

Powered by Airbus' pioneer spirit and infused with Navtech's agility, it combines the best of both worlds. A leading global provider of flight operations solutions serving more than 400 airlines and aviation service companies across all platforms, NAVBLUE has a proven track record in product innovation. Please apply on line for this vacancy using your e-Recruiting profile with your CV attached.

Description of the job :
A vacancy for a Business Development & Partnerships Manager (m/f) has arisen within NAVBLUE in Toulouse.

The jobholder will report to NAVBLUE’s Head of Business Development & Partnerships. In the field of airline flight operations, SIO mission is to incubate opportunities from idea to market-tested solutions by maximizing the value creation for both NAVBLUE and its customers.

The jobholder will lead “Business Development & Partnerships” activities. He/she has the accountability for developing business development plan and for managing corporate venturing and partnerships to accelerate company profitable growth and to improve competitivity by capturing internal & external flight operations product and service innovation opportunities in line with company strategy.

The jobholder manages the engagement of Early Adopters from the early phases of the innovation development with the goal to better design future products and to turn these customers into advocate

This role involves some travel and credibly representing the organization internally and externally.

Task & accountabilities :
Your main tasks and activities will include:

Business Development Plan:
Lead and maintain market-oriented business development plan based on corporate strategy and market information with the support of the SIO teams:
o Translate corporate strategy and market understanding information into tactical plan focusing on value added business opportunities.
o Lead identification of new business development opportunities in close relationships with NAVBLUE functions and relevant Airbus and Airbus Group organizations (e.g. Digital Transformation Office, BizLabs, Corporate Innovation, A^3, Airbus Group Ventures, etc.)
o Qualify and prioritize growth opportunities based on key strategic criteria
Elaborate and communicate NAVBLUE Business Development Plan as a reference to achieve growth objectives.

Business Development Opportunity Analysis:
Lead the preparation of business plans for growth opportunities:
o Drive and manage new opportunity assessments and competitive analyses, work with cross-functional teams (within SIO, within NAVBLUE, with Airbus) to develop in-depth ad-hoc understanding of technologies, business models, global markets and competitive landscapes.
o Drive and manage new partnerships deal due-diligence processes through cross-functional teamwork, including financial modelling, process planning and execution for licensing, partnering and potential M&A opportunities.
o Elaborate business plan document and synthetic dossiers for the Executive Team and the Board of Directors.
Lead the engagement of Early Adopters for innovation projects.
Contribute to decision board with senior management to implement the growth opportunity

Business Development Implementation:
Propose and negotiate partnerships with potential partners (within Airbus Group and outside) in the frame of the opportunity implementation with the support of the functions.
o Support the Contracts team in the elaboration of the contracts, SLA, etc. to ensure successful alliances or partnerships relationships.
Support the implementation of opportunities with the different functions within NAVBLUE and partners until full handover.
Monitor and report back to Senior Management on progress and adjustments through the Business Development dashboard.
Maintain and follow-up contractual relationship with partners.
The jobholder will represent, on request, the organization in internal & external forums/events and support marketing actions from a business perspective

OUTPUTS:
o Identify & assess new partnerships opportunities in close relationships with NAVBLUE functions and relevant Airbus organizations
o Develop quality relationships with managers and decision makers of current NAVBLUE partners (internal & external to Airbus Group)
o Maintain a Partnerships Development dashboard for the Executive Team
o Establish value proposition, business model and business case for new product and services opportunities to support board decisions
o Manage the Early Adopter engagement and set up the associated contractual agreements in line with new product development roadmaps
o Elaborate synthetic dossiers for the Executive Team and the Board of Directors
o Provide the business content of communication kit

Required skills :
As the successful candidate, you should be able to demonstrate the following skills and competencies:

Education:
Degree in Business or a similar discipline from an accredited post-secondary institution
Experience:
5 to 10 years’ experience in Marketing, Sales or Business Development roles

Knowledge, Skills, Demonstrated Capabilities & Competencies:
Excellent commercial and business knowledge as well as technical expertise with a strong ability to understand customers’ and business partners’ needs and demands
Entrepreneurial mindset with excellent analytical and problem-solving skills: Business goals/achievements, result oriented, strategic vision, customer focus and perseverance with passion to win
Strong ability to work in a team and act as a leader, showing aptitude to innovate and lead change. Strong ability to adapt in a dynamic, ever changing environment
Understanding of Airbus network

Communication Skills (Spoken, Written, Influencing, Proficiency in Other Languages):
Strong interpersonal, communication and negotiation skills with aptitude in building relationships with professionals of all organizational levels
Business & negotiation level in English

Technical Systems Proficiency:
Experience in Services or Flight Ops challenges in the aerospace industry
Interest in new digital technologies, trend setters, big data. Knowledge or experience in LEAN start-up, Design Thinking and Agile methodologies would be a plus

Travel Required:
Willingness to travel: ~10% Domestic and International

Retail Accounts
Proactive Business Partner to Retail Division
Responsible for ensuring that new JCDecaux Street Furniture and Retail fixed assets are captured on the fixed asset register

Report JCDecaux Retail revenue to France (FLASH)

Liaise with the Business Intelligence Analyst to create useful Business Objects reports e.g. Fixed assets analysis
Reconcile Retail WSS revenue to Retail sales invoices

Obtain reports for monthly installations and removals of street furniture from Estates and reconcile against stock issued for the Street Furniture Self Created Fixed Assets
Reconcile the general ledger account for deferred stock issues, and current stock issues for all Street furniture items that need to be capitalised

Dispose of relevant fixed assets as per the reports provided by Estates.
Capitalise all new IT Hardware and Software, and other Non-Patrimony assets purchased.
Update all FA spreadsheets and reconcile these to the Balance Sheet General Ledger accounts and Asset4000
Update Capex reports, and consult with Street Furniture Development for monthly amendments
Reconciliation of Fixed Assets Register to Gemeo & Sage

Stock
Reconcile Production issues per the Business Objects report to general ledger
Reconcile all Intercompany Stock issues and consult with Project Management Team to rectify any inconsistencies.
Post and create all stock journals at month end for Profit & Loss and Balance Sheet; production/ maintenance issues, Self Created Fixed Assets, returns to stock, stock adjustments

Reconcile Large Format, Rail and Airport Stock issues and invoice accordingly; ensuring that Large Format and Rail Capex is invoiced in current period

Ensure the correct data is uploaded for all goods received before submitting to HMRC.
Check with HMRC for any updates to Commodity codes, and ensure that these are updated by Street Furniture Logistics
Reconcile all credits and returns, as well as inconsistencies and rectify these prior to submission

Process the POP accrual reports and journal, and run the audit trails for Street Furniture.

Responsibility for reconciliation of nominated General Ledger accounts as required by Financial Reporting Manager/Group Financial Controller
Ad hoc
To carry out additional tasks and or different tasks within your capabilities as required by the Financial Reporting Manager/Group Financial Controller

PC literate for various software packages: SAGE – UK accounts system; Merlin – Sales booking system; Hyperion – used for management accounts review and reporting and SAPHIR – French reporting system
Knowledge of Microsoft Office – especially Excel (v-look ups and pivot tables
Qualifications
Graduate with preferably Maths / Business Studies degree
Studying for professional qualification (Part Qual ACCA / CIMA preferred) / AAT qualified

Job Description
What if YOU start you adventure with US?
As part of a school curriculum in you are looking for a mandatory internship or integrated into a gap year, lasting for a maximum 6 months, that will allow you to validate your studies.
We are giving you the opportunity to work within a world-leading company, focused on digital transformation, at the cutting edge of research and innovation.
A vacancy for an internship in the Use of SKYWISE database (m/f) has arisen within Airbus at our Toulouse Blagnac site.
This internship will start from January 2020 (dates are subject to some flexibility).
You will join the AIRBUS Service Bulletins department. The Service Bulletin (SB) is a document approved by the Certification Authorities and which allows to modify the aircraft definition after delivery.
The instruction of a SB requires various skills in the technical, commercial and production management fields. Depending on the classification of the SB, the airline can decide to implement the SB on its fleet or to not take it into consideration.
SKYWISE is a database used to collect the information provided by in-service aircraft, in particular to follow up on the implementation of SB.
The aim of the internship will be to use the date provided by SKYWISE and to monitor the rate of penetration of SB at airlines.
The analysis of this date will make it possible to define the main criteria used by the customers to decide on the integration of SB on their fleets.
This summary will be used to revise the criteria matrix used at AIRBUS to launch the instruction of SB.
A particular focus will be placed on the SBs approved upstream with customers to clearly demonstrate that the implementation rate of these SB is higher than those that are not co-defined with the companies.
A specific analysis will also be carried out on SB which have a very low rate of penetration: after the efficiency analysis of the technical solution, a promotion action can be initiated to promote these SB towards customers.
Tasks & responsibilities:
You will be under the responsibility of a manager who will help you identify your professional objectives and support you in the development of your skills.
In this context, your main activities will include:
Performing a detailed analysis of the data present in SKYWISE
Defining the application criteria of SB for airlines
Updating the internal decision matrix
Launching actions to promote SB with very low application rates
Setting up a specific follow-up on SBs co-defined with the support of airlines
Proposing improvements for the application used to manage SB data in SKYWISE with a study to extend it to other perimeters such as SB issued by suppliers
Required profile and skills:
You are completing a 5-year degree in Engineering or equivalent, with a focus on Software Engineering and you have the following skills:
English: ADVANCED LEVEL
French: ADVANCED LEVEL
A strong interest in the digital world and digital data tools
Knowledge of the aerospace environment
Interpersonal skills:
Meticulous, inquisitive and independent
Good interpersonal skills and good communication skills
Ability to integrate into an international team and adapt easily
Recognised for your organisational skills
Ability to analyse and synthesise
and a team spirit.
Depending on the proposed offers, you may be required to travel.
If your profile catches our attention, you will be invited to perform a video interview during which you will have a few minutes to convince us. Afterwards, your application could be proposed to the managers.

This job requires an awareness of any potential compliance risks and a commitment to act with integrity, as the foundation for the Company’s success, reputation and sustainable growth.

By submitting your CV or application you are consenting to Airbus using and storing information about you for monitoring purposes relating to your application or future employment. This information will only be used by Airbus.
Airbus is committed to achieving workforce diversity and creating an inclusive working environment. We welcome all applications irrespective of social and cultural background, age, gender, disability, sexual orientation or religious belief.

description:
Airbus Operations SAS
Airbus is a global leader in aeronautics, space and related services. In 2018 it generated revenues of € 64 billion and employed a workforce of around 134,000. Airbus offers the most comprehensive range of passenger airliners. Airbus is also a European leader providing tanker, combat, transport and mission aircraft, as well as one of the world's leading space companies. In helicopters, Airbus provides the most efficient civil and military rotorcraft solutions worldwide.

Our people work with passion and determination to make the world a more connected, safer and smarter place. Taking pride in our work, we draw on each other's expertise and experience to achieve excellence. Our diversity and teamwork culture propel us to accomplish the extraordinary - on the ground, in the sky and in space.
Job Description
What if YOU starts your journey with US!
As part of , you are looking for a mandatory internship or integrated into a gap year that will allow you to validate your studies. The internship duration is 4 to 6 months maximum.
We offer you to work in a world-leading company which is at the heart of a digital transformation, at the cutting edge of research and innovation.
We are looking for Internship on Digital Flight Test Customer Report improvement (m/f) who will be joining us at Airbus site in Toulouse.
This internship is to be filled from Feb, 3rd 2020 to July 31th 2020.
You will be joining the department A/C Test & Operations Support which activities include Software development & support for testing on production, development, and in-service A/C. The technical domain of the internship is around a tool suite dedicated to testing of production A/C.
The objective of the internship is to rework the digital generation of reports to perform new reports (with internal airbus tools: CuPTeR, PATCC) with a dynamic technology, friendly format and independ of Office tools (Word).
Tasks and Responsibilities :
You will be working under the supervision of your manager who will help you identify your professional objectives and support you in the development of your skills.
Your main activities will include:
Facilitate generation and improve content of the Customers reports of production flight tests
Manage new evolutions in the CuPTeR (internal tool to handle digital Flight test customer reports format&content) easily and less costly
via tool improvement: reduce lead time for Flight Test Engineer work during Customer phase
Be independent of Office tools and Gsuite: technical solutions already proposed by partners shall be benchmarked during the internship. Stakeholders for this study are: developers of the Production Aircraft Test System, users of PATS (flight crew on production A/C, flight Test support Engineers).
Required skills:
You are preparing a diploma level Bac+ 5 Master or engineering school, in Software engineering or equivalent, with specialisation in data processing / programming and you obtain following competences:
English: INTERMEDIATE
French: ADVANCED
Your first experience has enabled you to be familiar with industrial needs in term of process improvements through IT developments
You are interested in challenging industrial objectives, with the aim to bring value to a business by applying & developing your skills.
You have a good knowledge of programming / document edition tools
You are able to use proficiently such languages & techno as C/ html / web
Soft skills:
Rigorous, curious and autonomous
Able to integrate into team and be a flexible team player: multi-team interaction is a key factor for this internship
Able to analyze and synthesize information
If your profile catches our attention, you will be invited to perform a video interview during which you will have a few minutes to tell us about your background, motivations and your professional project. Afterwards, your application could be proposed to the managers for further review.
If the prospect of joining our innovative Group motivates you do not hesitate and apply online on our website www.airbus.com/careers!

Sales Representative - Ingénieur Commercial (IoT, Consulting, France) F/H
Esprit RH - Toulouse (31)
titre_poste: Sales Representative - Ingénieur Commercial (IoT, Consulting, France) F/H
date_publication:

Signaler cette offre d'emploi
description:
Ingénieur commercial - IoT Valley Toulouse 09-2019
L'IoT Valley est un écosystème de startups, référence dans l’exploitation des objets connectés et de leurs datas en Europe. Au sud de Toulouse, une équipe de 40 personnes apportent au quotidien un maximum de valeur aux startups pour qu’elles atteignent rapidement une croissance exponentielle et répondent aux problèmes qu’elles souhaitent adresser. Pour cela L’IoT Valley va au-devant des clients, ETI ou grands comptes de l’industrie et des services, pour proposer des missions de conseil en innovation. La finalité du consulting produit par les chefs de projets est de réduire les coûts, améliorer la performance opérationnelle et créer de nouveaux services. L’IoT Valley mobilise des ressources propres pour délivrer un conseil opérationnel, de l’audit d’étonnement au projet de déploiement de solutions à destination du manufacturing, des building systems ou de la supply chain. Les missions vont de plusieurs dizaines à quelques centaines de K€ avec un taux de récurrence élevé.
Pourquoi rejoindre l’IoT Valley ?
S’investir dans le projet de l’IoT Valley c’est vouloir travailler de façon innovante dans une univers de création de service et d’innovations technologiques. C’est surtout améliorer en permanence sa façon de voir les choses et pour les réaliser, construire collectivement des solutions et ne pas sentir de barrière à son propre fonctionnement. L’IoT Valley interpelle les managers du comex CEO, COO, CTO, CMO sur des sujets stratégiques. Elle donne à tous ses collaborateurs comme à ses startups les moyens de signer des missions très ‘touchy’, de réaliser des contrats très ambitieux, d’envisager des solutions imaginatives voire disruptives et où les moyens du client sont la seule limite.
Bosser et faire grandir l’IoT Valley
Faire du business à l’IoT Valley c’est exercer son métier dans une sorte de laboratoire sur les rapports humains, sur les méthodes, sur les services vendus.
La création du service est récente, mais les méthodes sont déjà là, marketing digital et growth hacking pour générer des leads. Votre imagination sera sollicitée pour identifier de nouveaux segments, atteindre des décideurs, faire du cross-selling, favoriser la mise en relation, construire des partenariats. Le CRM est l’outil central, il demande attention et du temps pour délivrer l’information utile à votre prospection et finalement simplifier le reporting.
En possession des orientations stratégiques et des conseils du Key Sales Manager vous aurez tout loisir pour définir vos priorités et votre plan d’action.
En synthèse vos missions sont :
- Cibler vos segments (ETI et grands comptes) et qualifier vos prospects
- Approcher les cibles (E-mailing, calls, growthhacking, réseautage)
- Mapper le compte et établir une stratégie de compte
- Conduire toutes les étapes du processus de vente
- Construire les propositions avec le KAM, Le KSM et le marketing
- Négocier et closer avec la direction des entreprises
- Assurer le reporting et maintenir la liaison avec les autres IC et les chefs de projets
Le profil du futur Sales representative
Le Sales Rep. est avant tout un professionnel de la relation commerciale. Orienté chasse, il sait organiser et orienter son action en fonction des spécificités du compte. Spécialiste de la vente de service, il sait d’abord découvrir les besoins du CEO ou des manager du comex.Il travaille en réseau, considère son action comme un véritable projet qu’il animera en autonomie. Il a une vue globale sur le fonctionnement d’une entreprise ou d’une BU. A la fois résistant à la pression et sensible aux stimulations internes, guidé par ses objectifs, il s’impose ses propres métriques et tient son tableau de bord. Pour performer il s’appuiera sur une expérience réussie dans la vente de services auprès de dirigeants, idéalement du consulting autour de l’innovation.
Le poste est basé à Labège au sud de Toulouse.
La rémunération comprends Fixe selon potentiel et variable (10 % objectif atteint)
Au sujet du process de recrutement
- Pour augmenter votre visibilité, étudiez le contexte du projet et motivez votre démarche par écrit.
- Les candidatures en ligne avec les attentes du client recevront un descriptif de poste très complet en même temps qu’un lien pour remplir un questionnaire en ligne.
- Les premiers et deuxième entretien seront conduits par le cabinet. Le premier via Skype le deuxième en présentiel. Il comprendra un assesment, un entretien sur la carrière et les compétences acquises, un entretien sur les motivations et objectifs de carrière.
Type d'emploi : CDI
Expérience:
sales representative f/h ou similaire: 2 ans (Souhaité)

Product Owner ENOC W/M
Looking for the next step in your career? Enjoy a challenge? Do you have an ambition for innovation? Want to make a difference?
If you join our growing global team, you’ll be working for an industry leader with offices across five continents, in over 47 countries and more than 28 000 employees. You will work with some of the leading world brands across the Fortune 100 and Fortune 500 companies – who are all relying on Dimension Data to help them use the power of technology to achieve their ambition in this digital era.You’ll be part of a team who’s passionate about making a difference to the way technology shapes how we live and work – whether it’s protecting the rhino, connecting the G20 Summit, or revolutionising cycling, giving you the opportunity to do great things.
You’ll be joining a Global Top Employer, recognised for investing in talent because people are at the heart of our success. You provide the skills, passion and ideas, and we’ll provide the platform to realise your ambitions.Great talent. Great teams. Great work. Great opportunities.
Want to be part of our team?
Your mission:

Product Availability and Performance management
o In coordination with the Supervision, Integration services and L2 Network and security teams, ensure that all SLAs and Key performance indicators related to your product are measured and reported consistently
o Monitor continuously your product performance and feed a Continuous Service Improvement plan in coordination with your client and your Head of Product Service Line.
o In coordination with the supervision team, ensure that all technical incidents are handled in a timely manner in accordance with our SLAs and business expectations
o In coordination with all contributors, ensure that all problems and changes are managed following the process and best practices defined with Airbus teams.
o In coordination with Airbus teams, ensure that all technical perimeter is compliant with Airbus standard configurations in accordance with our SLAs and KPIs and business expectations
o In coordination with the Automation Product owner, your squad and the central services team, work at continuously improving the efficiency of your product operations via automation, scripting and tooling.
o In coordination with the Head of Product Service Line, regularly report and control your product’s performance, quality, and cost drivers (product financials) to contribute to client and internal monthly reporting.

Planning and controlling product evolution
o Review and plan jointly with our client the product road map and transformation planning to constantly meet business expectations
o Assessment of the potential impacts of our client transformation roadmap to anticipate evolution of our resource, skills, tooling platform and financial plan
o Follow up of the transformation projects in coordination with our project teams and overlook the entry in service of new product/service components
o In coordination with our project teams, control that all changes and transformation are performed via a state-of-the-art change management and Entry in Service process allowing product availability continuity
o Contribute on the definition and validation of new service extension with Dimension Data Sales and Solutions teams

Client management
o Monitor and manage client satisfaction via regular face to face interactions within standard governance as well as informal meetings
o Act as the single point of contact for your client’s operational team and be the representative of our company on the product’s scope by acting as a seamless integrator of all other business lines (Technology, Maintenance and Managed Service).
o Be accountable for your perimeter to honor the commitments to the client, whether they are an SLA or a volume of available capacity (e.g. request bandwidth). Address with the client any conflict coming from these commitments not being met or the client requiring something above commitment.
o Detect and analyze out of scope request from your client and raise it to the appropriate contact in our organization to ensure that it is properly addressed and further reinforce client satisfaction.

Management
o Be the transversal manager of a global product various countries to cover the geographical scope of our client. Manage priority and product bandwidth in collaboration with other technical product managers.
o Work with the central integration team to measure, report, and manage your squad activity in term of request execution (bandwidth) to ensure that the output bandwidth is aligned with the contractual engagements

Strong sense of service and Client Satisfaction
Soft skills and ability to interact with different client profiles
Transversal management skills,
Technical skills around network and security domain
Analytic mindset and fact-based thought process
Ability to adapt in a young dynamic and international environment
Excellent communication skills both written and oral
Synthetic mind and ability to bring clarity and simplicity in complex situations
Team player, positive mind set and a strong envy to make things move forward
