meta1:
SYSTEM ENGINEERING MANAGER (SEM) (H/F)
Thales Group1,226 avis - Toulouse (31)
date_publication:
Thales - il y a 26 jours
- Continuer pour postuler
Signaler cette offre d'emploi
description:
QUI SOMMES-NOUS ?
Thales propose des systèmes d’information et de communication sécurisés et interopérables pour les forces armées, les forces de sécurité et les opérateurs d’importance vitale. Ces activités, qui regroupent radiocommunications, réseaux, systèmes de protection, systèmes d’information critiques et cybersécurité, répondent aux besoins de marchés où l’utilisation des nouvelles technologies numériques est déterminante. Thales intervient tout au long de la chaîne de valeur, des équipements aux systèmes en passant par le soutien logistique et les services associés.
Le site de Toulouse-Labège développe, en tant que CESTI - Centre d’Évaluation de la Sécurité des Technologies de l’Information agréé par l’ANSSI - et dans le cadre d’un partenariat de plus de 20 ans avec le CNES, une offre intégrée d’expertise et d’évaluation qui s’étend des composants aux produits de sécurité matériels et/ou logiciels, de la carte électronique au système d’information. De plus, nos équipes de l’activité Systèmes d’information critiques et cybersécurité fournissent des services et des solutions globales optimisant la performance, la résilience et la sécurité des systèmes d’information afin de faire face aux ruptures technologiques et aux cybermenaces.
Dans le cadre de grands programmes Thales ou directement pour un client final du domaine Spatial, de l'Aéronautique, de l'Energie ou de l'e-Santé, le SEM est le pilote des activités techniques du projet.
Nous recherchons actuellement un SEM confirmé pour participer à l’un de nos projets mettant en œuvre plusieurs sous-systèmes HW et SW et impliquant des équipes de réalisation de plus de 10 personnes.
Le SEM doit être capable d'intervenir sur des projets complexes en étant interface du client sur les aspects d'ingénierie et de plan de développement du projet, de piloter les équipes techniques mettant en œuvre divers cycles de vie de développement.
QUI ETES VOUS ?
Issu(e) de formation universitaire ou Ingénieur(e) vous justifiez de 10 ans d'expérience dans le pilotage de projet de développement informatique et d'intégration système, idéalement pour des clients dans les domaines de l'aéronautique, du Spatial, de l'énergie ou de l'e-santé ?
Vous savez adopter des comportements gagnants face à des enjeux ou des risques importants?
Vous avez déjà piloter des équipes?
Vous êtes capable d'analyser et de sélectionner le cycle de vie de développement de la solution et les éléments de la solution dans un contexte complexe?
Vous êtes familier avec les outils de suivi de projet et le reporting sur l'avancement projet vis-à-vis du management interne?
Vous faites preuve d'une bonne capacité à synthétiser et à communiquer et faites preuve également d'une grande rigueur?
Vous avez une aisance relationnelle et le goût du travail en équipe?
Vous maitrisez l'anglais?
Une expérience de projet réalisé dans un contexte international est également souhaitée.
Des certifications telles PMP ou Agile sont appréciées.
Vous avez idéalement une expérience autour du Big data, Cloud, Orchestration, Sécurité, IA.
La capacité d'animation de communication, de compréhension de système complexe et l'expérience de management d'équipe sont clé pour la réussite de cette mission.
CE QUE NOUS POUVONS ACCOMPLIR ENSEMBLE :
Le SEM pilote les activités techniques du Projet :
Il définit le plan de réalisation de la solution dans son ensemble (logiciel, matériel, service), ainsi que l’organisation correspondante, les processus, pratiques et outils applicables à son projet en fonction des contraintes spécifiques (ex : outils imposés par le Client).
Dans le cadre de l’organisation du projet et en fonction de sa typologie, lui sont rattachés l’Architecte, un ou plusieurs SwEM (Software Element Manager) qui réalisent des parties de la solution, un SwIVM (Software Integration Validation Manager) en charge de l’intégration logicielle et des conditions de déploiement sur les matériels (avec des configurations, règles, et scripts), un SDM (System Delivery Manager) qui assure la bonne opération de la solution en production, des experts qui traitent des points techniques avancés.
Il approuve les plans des éléments de solution ou composants de niveau inférieur, y compris dans le cadre d’un mandat global, ceux des sous-traitants, et partenaires, et ceux fournis par le client, et il en assure ensuite la cohérence globale.
Il identifie les compétences d'ingénierie requises pour les livraisons, et il dirige et coordonne son équipe technique.
Dès la phase de réponse à l’appel d’offre et tout au long du projet, il est responsable de l’évaluation des charges, du planning des tâches techniques, du reste à faire ; il identifie et évalue les risques et opportunités techniques et les présente au PM (Project Manager).
Il est engagé sur la qualité des réalisations, les délais, et les coûts de production de la solution vis-à-vis du projet vendu, en optimisant la productivité et il remonte au PM les informations d’avancement techniques de son périmètre de responsabilité (indicateurs, difficultés, …).
Il garantit que les engagements vis à vis du projet incluent la satisfaction des exigences contractuelles du projet (coûts, délais, exigences normatives, dont sécurité) de son périmètre de responsabilité.
Il contribue aux activités d‘assurance qualité en garantissant au QAM (Quality Assurance Manager) la visibilité sur l’ensemble des travaux d'ingénierie du Projet et en garantissant la conformité des métriques et des processus définis.
En tant que responsable de l’ensemble des activités techniques d’un projet, il constitue un binôme avec le PM chargé du projet qu’il accompagne, assiste, et soutient lors des réunions client à la demande du PM.
Le SEM peut également être amené à exercer une responsabilité hiérarchique vis-à-vis des collaborateurs de son équipe. Dans ce rôle, il sera responsable de la tenue des entretiens de carrière et de la gestion quotidienne des congés, formations, missions, frais, … des membres de son équipe.
Innovation, passion, ambition : rejoignez Thales et créez le monde de demain, dès aujourd’hui.

Would you like join one of the fastest-growing organizations within Amazon Web Services (AWS) and help customers of all industries and sizes gain the best value and service from AWS? At AWS Enterprise Support we’re looking for a Senior Technical Account Manager (TAM) to support our customers’ creative and transformative spirit of innovation across all technologies, including Compute, Storage, Database, Data Analytics, Application-level services, Networking, Serverless and more. This is not a sales role, but rather an opportunity to be the principal technical advisor and ‘voice of the customer’ to organizations ranging from start-ups to Fortune 500 enterprises.
As a Senior TAM, you will help craft and execute strategies to drive customer adoption and use of AWS services, including EC2, S3, DynamoDB & RDS databases, Lambda, Cloud Front CDN, IoT and many more. Your technical acumen and customer-facing skills will enable you to effectively represent AWS within a customer’s environment, and drive discussions with senior leadership regarding incidents, trade-offs and risk management. You will provide advocacy and strategic technical direction to help plan and build solutions using standard methodologies, and enthusiastically keep your customers’ AWS environments operationally healthy. The close relationships developed with your customers will empower you to understand their business/operational needs and technical challenges, and help them achieve the greatest value from AWS.
We are seeking individuals with strong backgrounds in I.T. operations and related areas such as Linux/Windows systems administration, DevOps, Data Analytics and more. The TAM is our centerpiece of value to our Enterprise Support customers, so if you wish to be at the forefront of innovation, come join us!

Advanced experience in one or more of the following areas: Software Design or Development, Content Distribution/CDN, Scripting/Automation, Database Architecture, IP Networking, IT Security, BigData/Hadoop/Spark, Operations Management, Service Oriented Architecture
External enterprise customer-facing experience as a technical lead, with strong oral and written communication skills, presenting to both large and small audiences
Experience in a 24x7 operational services or support environment
Experience with AWS services and/or other cloud offerings

Description of the job :
A vacancy for a Skywise & Digital Office Finance Manager has arisen within Airbus (Commercial Aircraft) in Blagnac. You will report to the Head of Finance for Technology, Innovation and Digital Transformation.
The Finance team is seeking new talents to support the Airbus Digital transformation. Jobholder’s responsibility includes, amongst other projects, the Skywise Platform. The Jobholder shall be open to Innovation and Digital matters, pragmatic, agile and at ease with the speed of action required by the Digital Transformation organizations.

Task & accountabilities :
Your main tasks and responsibilities will include:
provide quantitative and qualitative data to support discussions and decision making at Management level (incl. Business Cases, Value Assessment, Sensitivity Analysis)
prepare robust financial planning and forecast, manages risks & opportunities
assess performance against budgets/targets highlighting discrepancies and propose mitigation actions if needed
challenge and support project leaders on all financial matters and operational performance improvement
develop, together with Skywise team, a robust monetization strategy (digital platform business model)
ensuring full compliance of financial transactions

Required skills :
You will have the following skills and experience:
Educated to a Master degree level in Finance or related discipline with at least 5 years experience in Finance,
Experience in Financial modelling and Data Platform monetization,
Experience in Information Technology,
Ability to question and challenge,
Broad understanding of company strategy and challenges,
Excellent written and verbal communication skills,
Curious, strong appetite to dive into new topics and digest a large amount information,
Ability to work independently and to engage with internal stakeholders at all levels,
Ability to switch from big picture to detailed view,
Language Skills: negotiation level of English. French and/or German would be a plus.

This job requires an awareness of any potential compliance risks and a commitment to act with integrity, as the foundation for the Company’s success, reputation and sustainable growth.

Apprendre chaque jour, battre des records, te dépasser dans tes missions. Voilà, dans les grandes lignes, ce qui t’attend chez Brigad. Dans le détail, tu participeras au développement commercial de la ville puis seras en charge de faire croître le nombre de clients et de maintenir une croissance exponentielle, mois par mois.

MISSION

Création et développement de listes de premiers prospects qualifiés (Secteur Food & Beverage)
Démarchage téléphonique + rdv physique
Activation des établissements inscrits sur Brigad.co
Gestion et développement d’un portefeuille de clients
Suivi et optimisation de tes performances via un CRM
Animation des sessions physiques d’onboarding Brigader
Quelques mots sur BRIGAD

Nous développons la meilleure solution pour mettre en relation des professionnels. Une entreprise a un besoin de personnel qualifié ? BRIGAD s’occupe de tout, sur plateforme et application.

21 janvier 2016 : Lancement de BRIGAD
24 mai 2016 : BRIGAD est lauréate #UberPITCH 2016.
8 août 2016 : Première levée de fonds auprès de 50 Partners Capital, Uber technologies Inc. et des investisseurs privés.
1 février 2017 : Lévée de fond de 2,4 millions d’euros ️
Novembre 2017 : Lancement du service Brigad à Lyon.
Avril 2018 : Lancement du service à Londres.
Janvier 2019 : Expansion géographique du service en France.
Profil recherché Nous recherchons un profil ayant au minimum un an d’expérience en tant que Business Developer et/ou Account manager. Une connaissance du secteur CHR serait un avantage considérable.

Trois composantes majeures du poste de Business Developer :
Performance

: atteindre et dépasser les objectifs ambitieux fixés en ligne avec la forte croissance de Brigad à Toulouse.

Organisation

: bonne répartition des actions entre la chasse de nouveaux comptes stratégiques et le développement du portefeuille de clients existants. Être organisé(e) et rigoureux est indispensable pour ce poste.

Autonomie

: équipe locale à forte responsabilité.

Ce profil devra également avoir un attrait pour la gestion de data et la création de reporting, afin de mesurer au mieux le resultat des actions prises et l’évolution du portefeuille clients.

Si tu aimes le challenge, travailler dans un environnement très dynamique ce poste est fait pour toi !
Entreprise Brigad creates the future of work by enabling hundreds of thousands of professionals in the hospitality industry to work as self-employed. Our app connects highly skilled individuals with businesses that require their skill set on a short term basis.

We believe in benevolent and useful innovation, in work as a cornerstone of society, in the design of simple solutions that are accessible to all.

Brigaders are the new superheroes. A new world of work is being shaped and we are part of it.

Launching in Paris in 2016 Brigad has connected over 5 000 qualified individuals with over 1 Million hours of work offered by over 2 000 active businesses in the hospitality sector using our market leading technology. Brigad has raised over €15m since August 2016. With offices in Paris, London and 4 other cities in France, the Brigad team has grown to 75 employees and is now looking to expand in the Benelux, starting with Amsterdam.

“ ️A new World of work is currently being shaped and we are part of it ️”

description:
NXP Semiconductors N.V. enables secure connections for a smarter world, advancing solutions that make lives easier, better, and safer. As the world leader in secure connectivity solutions for embedded applications, NXP is driving innovation in the automotive, industrial & IoT, mobile, and communication infrastructure markets. Built on more than 60 years of combined experience and expertise, the company has approximately 30,000 employees in more than 30 countries and posted revenue of $9.41 billion in 2018.
In the Automotive group, the ADAS Product Line from NXP semiconductor and more specifically the Product engineering team focusing on Radar 77Ghz sensor ICs development is now looking for an Analog and RF Product Engineer.
In this exciting role, you will be challenged by taking your part in the future of Automotive working on smart radar sensors towards the autonomous driving cars.
Product engineer, you’re familiar with statistical tools using test data to analyze product capabilities and setting improvement action plans. You’re understanding the reliability stresses to qualify ASIC products as well as the implications die to package. You’re in charge of the manufacturability and industrialization of products.
Your responsibilities
You are responsible in development of production launch phases of the product compliancy to the specification
You work in an international project team in collaboration with Design, Lab, Test and Quality engineers under the responsibility of a project manager.
You are engaged and closely collaborate with various manufacturing site in Asia/USA for industrialization and volume production ramp-up.
You rigorously analyses the product capability, work-report-follow improvement plan you define through lab characterization, Failure analysis, Test improvements or design improvements.
Within the technical community you share best practices and participate to continuous improvement processes.
Your profile
5 years of experience in IC microelectronic development as Product engineer, Designer, Reliability/Lab engineer or Test engineer preferably into automotive constraints.
Good expertise in Analog and microwave/RF domain following a Master Degree or equivalent in Electrical Engineering.
Solid understanding of PCB development (schematic, VHDL/Verilog) intended for product reliability.
Good level in Software development language (C/C++, Visual Basic, Python, Assembler…)
Solid understanding of statistic and configuration management.
Curious, flexible, autonomous, entrepreneurial attitude, Creative.
Requires experience with cross functional teams and effective communication skills to operate in a global environment with multiple partners in Europe, Asia and USA. Fluent English is required.
We offer an energizing working environment with an excellent team active with cutting-edge technology, you will become part of NXP Semiconductors (NASDAQ: NXPI), the number one in Automotive portfolio. We also offer an excellent salary and benefits package and relocation support is provided if required.
Do you want to be a part of a semiconductor engine for the connected world and co-create the future? Please apply via our career page: www.nxp.com/careers

Description of the job :
A position of Programme Performance Manager (m/f) has just been opened at STELIA Aerospace in Toulouse.
As part of the Airbus Helicopters Program team, you will report to the Program Director and be part of the Program's management staff.
You will be co-pilot of the program manager and will be in charge of defining, updating and analyzing the various performance management indicators (Planning, costs, quality, resources, production preparation).
You will support the person in charge of Elementary Parts in order to set up the reporting allowing a fine management of the activity (LoB, medium/long term vision, economic).

Travel is to be expected (once or twice a month) and as a result, you must be willing to travel accordingly.

Task & accountabilities :
Your main tasks will be as follows:
Define the tools, indicators or monitoring methods,
Guarantee the deployment and continuous improvement of P&PM methods and tools for the Program,
Propose facilitation methods that simplify the exchange of information between the multi-business team, highlight risks and opportunities and facilitate decision-making,
Harmonize and simplify the various reporting, routines and instances,
Analyze the various subjects and propose work axes to the program manager and the MFT (Multifunctional team),
Develop business expertise on program management methods and tools to support PPMs and cross-functional program teams,
Anticipate potential problems and implement derisking actions,
To be the point of support for the elementary parts program manager on all activity monitoring actions (economic, deadline),
Report on the progress of the elementary parts to the program manager.

Required skills :
We are looking for candidates with the following skills and experience:
Holder of a diploma at Bac+4/5 level,
Minimum 5 years of experience in Project and/or Program Management
Experience in structuring, Risk Management, Resources Management,
Knowledge :
o in reporting, indicators, control room,
o in supply chain and environment Elementary Parts (manufacturing process by technology),
o SAP, Pack Office, dashboarding tools (Power BI or equivalent),
Ability to work in a complex & multi-trade environment, and with strong challenges,
Ability to work in a team,
Strong ability to influence, make decisions and have an analytical mind,
Continuous improvement orientation,
Resilience and obstinacy,
Advanced level in French and English.

Ce poste exige une connaissance des risques potentiels de non-conformité. Le/la titulaire s’engage à agir avec intégrité, fondement du succès, de la réputation et de la croissance durable de la Société.

En soumettant votre CV ou votre candidature, vous autorisez Airbus à utiliser et stocker des informations vous concernant à des fins de suivi de votre candidature ou de futurs emplois. Ces informations ne seront utilisées que par Airbus.
Airbus s’engage pour la Diversité. Nous encourageons toutes les candidatures indépendamment de l’origine sociale et culturelle, de l’âge, du genre, du handicap, de l’orientation sexuelle ou des croyances religieuses.

Job Description
Company :
NAVBLUE is the new generation of digital, user-friendly Flight Operations and Air Traffic Management solutions. Powered by Airbus' pioneer spirit and infused with Navtech's agility, it combines the best of both worlds. A leading global provider of flight operations solutions serving more than
400 airlines and aviation service companies across all platforms, NAVBLUE has a proven track record in product innovation. With access to Airbus' resources and data, NAVBLUE provides its customers with the best solutions based on the best data, fully supporting them in their digital transformation.
NAVBLUE is a fully owned subsidiary of Services by Airbus and is based in Hersham (UK), Toulouse (France) and Waterloo, ON (Canada), with offices around the world.

Contact :
Please apply on line for this vacancy using your e-Recruiting profile with your CV attached.
By submitting your CV or application, you are consenting to Airbus and/or NAVBLUE using and storing information about you for monitoring purposes relating to your application or future employment. This information will only be used by Airbus and/or
NAVBLUE.

Description of the job :
A vacancy for a Flight Data Analyst & Project Manager (m/f) has arisen within NAVBLUE in Toulouse.

The Project Manager reports to the Head of Consulting team within the NAVBLUE #irline Flight Operations Solutions business line.
He/she coordinates a multifunctional project team composed of Subject Matter Experts, consultants, pilots and subcontractors (external).
He/she supplies technical expertise in Flight Data Analysis (FDA) domain to various NAVBLUE projects (consulting, services and products).
He/she manages external stakeholders including Airlines Flight Operations, Training, Safety departments as well as local Airworthiness Authorities.

The Project Manager is responsible to manage execution of a set of projects worldwide after hand-over from sales and to ensure commitments are met in terms of timing, quality and budget.
In order to do so he/she will work with Customers in a global environment driven by efficiency and safety performance.

He/she is accountable for:
Managing the global customer relationship and understanding complex situations from various flight operations and safety performance perspectives
Managing a broad project team (pilots, flight ops and safety management experts)
Supplying technical expertise in Flight Data Analysis (FDA) domain to various
NAVBLUE projects.

This role requires frequent international business trips.

Task & accountabilities :
Your main tasks and activities will include:
The jobholder will participate to the development of all NAVBLUE activities in the domain of flight data analysis and safety management with a primary focus on the Flight Data Analysis management service and safety program projects:
Be the technical referent for the flight data analysis preparation
Lead and manage projects (engagement leader) from beginning to end:

o Define project scope with the understanding of each Airline organization
o Set up and coordinate a multifunctional project team composed of experts, pilots and subcontractors (external)
o Manage external stakeholders including airlines Flight Operations and Safety departments
o Manage several projects per year
o Coordinate with several Airbus and NAVBLUE departments.
Ensure contract implementation on time, on quality and on budget:
o Stakeholders management up to CEO level
o Risk and Cost Management
o Operationally manage a transversal team
o Interface with the Customer
o Ensure adherence to NAVBLUE product related processes.
Collect and provide to the Consulting team relevant feedback on project implementation (lessons-learnt), propose continuous improvement of NAVBLUE product, support Sales and Marketing team (marketing material preparation and sales campaign activity).

Required skills :
Master degree in Aeronautics with a minimum 10 years’ experience within the field of safety management and flight data analysis in an Airline Safety department a previous commercial pilot experience is considered as additional asset
Operational practice of Flight Data Monitoring software (AirFASE or equivalent), occurrence analysis, crew interview, threat and error management and safety investigation
Knowledge of Air Transport System, ops regulation and international standards
Expertise in audit techniques to assess organization, people, tools/means (Problemsolving, analytical and strategic planning ability)
Expertise in risk assessment and root cause analysis
Ability to manage a team, to convince people, to make decisions and to report to executive levels
Experience in project management (Stakeholders and suppliers management, Risk and cost management as well as project governance)
Advanced interpersonal and communication (both oral and written) skills (strong coordination and relational skills needed to deal with customers and aviation experts)
Entrepreneurial, creative & business minded
Negotiation level in English.

The position has been graded IIIA/IIIB.

This job requires an awareness of any potential compliance risks and a commitment to act with integrity, as the foundation for the Company’s success, reputation and sustainable growth.

Contact :
Please apply on line for this vacancy using your eRecruiting profile with your CV attached (in English).

Description of the job :
Airbus has started its digital transformation, with the objective of optimizing operations and proposing new services, through the exploitation of data.

To Build-up procurement contribution of a future digital company PDYA department is in charge to Govern, manage & provide high Quality data, drive automated self-services reporting via enhanced analytics solutions,

Working within Procurement Advanced Data Analytics & Governance PYDA in Global Procurement Strategy & Services directorate (PY) of all Airbus Procurement & Supply Chain entities around 3000 employees (Commercial Aircraft, Defence & Space, Helicopters), you will be responsible of:

Mission:
Provide and implement the foundation of Advanced Data Analytics thanks to a robust & clear business data model and ontology for all Airbus solutions (e.g. DDMS - Digital Design, Manufacturing & Services , Skywise - Data Lake, ... ) to support transparency, decision making and drive associated change management between Airbus, Suppliers & Airlines

The position is based in Toulouse - reporting to the Head of Procurement End to End Data Governance & Business Data Architecture - PYDAG .

Task & accountabilities :
Your main tasks and activities will include:

PROJECT MANAGEMENT
Proactively understands and identifies the needs of business stakeholders/business key users and deliver on those needs. Create new insights & expand the data coverage / Quality within Airbus solutions (e.g. DDMS - Digital Design, Manufacturing & Services) and serve as a business champion.
Assessment of needs and requirements
Ensure end to end data continuity for Airbus between the different data sources using future digital platforms together with our consumers/stakeholders for the procurement perimeter especially to support DDMS transformation.
Preliminary/opportunity studies, use cases, ROI/Business Value in order to determine priorities
“High level functional business specifications' in alignment with operational (e.g. Application Product Owners), DTO/IT development teams and Regulation experts

Deliver the project within time, scope, cost and quality objectives and to customer satisfaction. Manage project stakeholder relationships as well as customer expectation and requirements. Outputs: Product / service / solution delivery to the customer according to defined and validated requirements.
Manage interface with Stakeholders
Conduct user interface testing
Communication, training, Inform Key users about other relevant changes
Define, plan and monitor data ingestion for Suppliers data on Skywise respecting/ clarifying the legal & contractual obligation towards our Supply base

BENCHMARK, STRATEGY AND EARLY ADOPTER
Be “superuser” and champion of advanced data analytic solutions and technologies to use for insight delivery as well as teach and train other business users.
Proactively identify new data sources (Internal or external) to incorporate into enterprise data environment.
Encourage and support self-service architectures to promote the enterprise goal of being a data-driven organization cross Airbus, Supplier and Airlines
Facilitate monitoring and reporting of the usage to identify opportunities and strategies to increase adoption
Define and plan long-term data architecture, strategy, data model & ontology for procurement in cooperation with IT / DTO and other functions (e.g. Finance, Manufacturing, Customer Services...)
Drive Harmonization and Improvement activities within Airbus Data Sources and external data sources related to strategic platforms (e.g. DDMS, Skywise,...)

Set and deploy common data standards with main focus to improve data quality / Integrity in accordance to data regulations.

PARTICIPATE ACTIVELY TO THE ENTERPRISE DATA GOVERNANCE EFFORTS
This job requires an awareness of any potential compliance risks and a commitment to act with integrity, as the foundation for the Company's success, reputation and sustainable growth.
Handle all data in accordance with Data Governance corporate guidelines to safeguard privacy and confidentiality, applying appropriate techniques to mask and encrypt sensitive data being sent outside the company
Incorporate file control totals, benchmark comparisons, statistical profiling and other appropriate techniques to ensure data quality and reliability.
Support the Procurement Data Officer for Airbus scope
Support process owner for the data/-flow management within P (Procurement) and in cooperation with other functions

MAJOR CHALLENGES
Foster harmonisation despite national approaches, legacy methods as well as cultural discrepancies.

Provide quick returns in a very stringent context
Ensure timely availability of business data for all Procurement functions to secure the capability to achieve required performance and cost reduction targets.
Avoid duplicate of data resources at their level.

Build up something new
Build up the Business data advanced Analytics, Reporting & Performance solutions in the frame of multicultural and multi functions (Procurement Commodity, Supply Chain, Finance, Sales, Engineering, Political Affairs, Strategy) teams with structured and
Reliable data analyse based on big data and improvement initiatives related to the topic.

Required skills :
We are looking for the following skills and experience:

Degree in Business Administration with specialization such as statistic, business intelligence, business project deployment or demonstrated previous experience in a similar position.
A minimum of 3 to 5 year’s experience in Digital/ Analytics Project management /development, preferably in the context of procurement or / and Supply chain activities
Technical & Analytical Skills
o Ability to translate business problems into meaningful insights
o Analytical and research skills/ Knowledge of data usage
o Highly interested by tools & data (Comfortable with professional tools, eager to learn how to use new ones...)
o Have knowledge of Advanced data analytics/ big data solutions to be able to push it
o A part of the job is to determine what data trends mean. Being able to analyse the data is crucial.
Project, organizational and time management skills
o To have strong co-ordination and project management skills to handle complex projects
o Coordination / management skills / International Team
o Committed, responsible / Autonomous way of working
o Acts with the appropriate sense of urgency to achieve results and meet expectations.
Communication and presentation skills

#ZIS




Description of the job :
You are interested by the Cyber Security and Digital Transfromation. You are willing to work in a multi-cultural environment, on a worldwide perimeter. Are you ready to take on a new and exciting challenge. Airbus gives you the opportunity to apply your expertise and develop your skills and competencies!
The company is undergoing a transformation into an agile, innovative, customer centric and digitally powered business. For the IT function this means having the unique opportunity to shift from an efficient enabler towards a creator of Business value!
Airbus is leader on the aircraft industry, offering many challenging opportunities and providing handful of benefits to its employees : world wide scope, access to key markets, mobility opportunities, and last but not least, a respectable work-life balance.
The Cyber Security Consultant will integrate ZISB (Digital Security & Cyber Consulting). He/she is a key person in charge of providing Cyber security consultancy, guidance and support to business projects. She/he has a worldwide coverage and is in regular contact with all IM Product managers and architects in Europe, Airbus remote offices and affiliates.
We are looking for motivated people with at least 5 years of experience and strong references, with excellent English communication and problem solving skills, the ability to understand complex systems processes, programs and accustomed to dealing with all levels from operational staff to senior management inside as well as outside IT.

Task & accountabilities :
The Cyber Security Consultant will be in charge of providing CyberSecurity consultancy to the business projects.
She/he will represent Airbus CyberSecurity department, engage business projects, create privileged partnership with major business domains and efficiently contribute to the design and the architecture of new solutions and backbones
This includes providing security expertise, collaborative definition of security measures and paradigms , ensuring intelligent balance between functional security and operational complexity , and easing the consultation/diffusion of security documentation.

As IM Cyber Security Consultant, you will :

# Have a collaborative mindset, and be a real team player (motivated & motivational )
# Challenge traditional ways of thinking and propose new ideas
# Provide professional cybersecurity consultancy and advisory to business projects
# Adopt and promote security-by-design approach with different projects stakeholders
# Proactively contribute to the business solutions’ design and architecture
# Design and architect following a comprehensive Risk-based methodology
# Manage publication of IM Security Standards and Blue Prints in Airbus Group worldwide context with Product managers, architects, and operational people and security experts.
# Act as the IT/IS Security focal point in his/her domain,
# Establish and maintain privileged relationship with these Airbus IM organizations,
# Ensure the good reporting for her/his activity

Required skills :
We seek out curious minds. We value attention to detail, and we care deeply about outcomes. We're looking above all for passionate people, eager to learn, willing to share, customer-centric, establishing innovative ways of working and influencing culture change.
Are you ready to share this exciting challenge with us?

To be considered you will need to confirm one or several of the following points in your skills profile:

# Bachelor to Master Degree in a Technical/IT discipline or equivalent experience
# demonstrable consultative approach through internal or external organizations with real customer-centric mindset.
# Certified to, or able to demonstrate strong working knowledge of ISO27001, CISSP or CSSP, CEH, OSCP ...Etc.
# Proven Track record in IT Security environment, IT/IS Architecture design and standards creation
# Previous experience on AWS/Azure, Firewalls, Bastion, SIEM, DLP, IAM, MFA/UFA, EDR, Encryption, antimalware, MPLS/SDWAN, IDS/IPS, proxies , HSMs, DevOvps, sandboxes (...etc.) is a plus.
# Ability to tackle of large range of security topics from hardware, networks, systems, applications to data, and new digital capabilities
# Security Audit and risk management
# Excellent communication and negotiation skills
# Excellent Organisational and interpersonal skill
# Leadership skills with the ability to drive a multi-functional team
# Advanced level of English
# Advanced level of French

Feel like you can't tick some boxes above? If you have most of the skills and experience that we're looking for and are willing to use your talent to learn the rest, we encourage you to apply!

#

Task & accountabilities :
The successful candidate will report directly to the Head of MVI (Most Valuable Information) in IM Cyber Security, based in the UK, and will be working closely with the IM Cyber Security Product Owner leading the same activity. The person will be responsible for establishment and execution of the integrated planning, becoming an expert across numerous security control technologies and processes, whilst ensuring that the overall approach and strategy remains aligned with both Business and Security/IM Cyber security strategies.
As MVI Remediation Manager, you will :

Engage with and build an integrated planning that encompasses all relevant security technical and process controls that are needed to deliver the highest level of security
Manage stakeholders and ensure execution of the plan
Perform security assessments of systems against Company (and industry) standards
Deliver dashboards and reporting to IM Cyber Security Management that demonstrate progress against targets
Update KPI’s for this activity
Deliver an agile and repeatable execution of the engagement process that delivers efficient and timely inputs from products owners (in Business and IM) into the security organisation
Ensure follow-up of control delivery and execution, and provide hands on support where that maybe required
Support and develop all processes and supporting key documentation.
Be responsible for contribution into the wider MVI Secure team. This is a new team and some flexibility will also be necessary.
Contribute to Monthly Security operational boards
Contribute to key IM Cyber projects and initiatives (Insider threat program etc.)

Company :
NAVBLUE is the new generation of digital, user-friendly Flight Operations and Air Traffic Management solutions. Powered by Airbus' pioneer spirit and infused with Navtech's agility, it combines the best of both worlds. A leading global provider of flight operations solutions serving more than 400 airlines and aviation service companies across all platforms, NAVBLUE has a proven track record in product innovation. With access to Airbus' resources and data, NAVBLUE provides its customers with the best solutions based on the best data, fully supporting them in their digital transformation.
NAVBLUE is a fully owned subsidiary of Services by Airbus and is based in Hersham (UK), Toulouse (France) and Waterloo, ON (Canada), with offices around the world.

Contact :
Please apply on line for this vacancy using your e-Recruiting profile with your CV attached.
By submitting your CV or application, you are consenting to Airbus and/or NAVBLUE using and storing information about you for monitoring purposes relating to your application or future employment. This information will only be used by Airbus and/or NAVBLUE.

Description of the job :
A vacancy for an Airspace Project Manager (M/F) has arisen within NAVBLUE in Toulouse.

The Airspace Project Manager (PM) (M/F) reports to the Head of Airspace Solutions. The team is providing Air Traffic Management (ATM) solutions to optimize Airlines flight operations and increase Airspace or Airport capacity.
He/she coordinates a multifunctional project team composed of Product Managers and Subject Matter Experts (NAVBLUE), aircraft experts (Airbus), expert consultants, pilots and subcontractors (external).
He/she will work with all Airlines’ departments involved (Flight Ops, Training, Engineering...), Civil Aviation Authorities (CAA), Air Navigation Services Providers (ANS) in a global environment driven by air traffic efficiency, capacity and safety.

This position has been graded PII / IIIA.

Task & accountabilities :
The Airspace Project Manager (M/F) is responsible to manage execution of a set of projects worldwide after hand-over from sales and to ensure commitments are met in terms of timing, quality and budget. Examples of projects are: implementation of PBN procedures, complete Airspace redesign, support to operational approval, etc.

Your main tasks and responsibilities will include:
Direct and manage the project implementation from beginning to end
Ensure the contract implementation on time, on quality and on budget
o Stakeholders management
o Risk and Cost Management (Project P&L)
o Accountable for all project deliverables
Operationally manage a transversal team (pilot, procedure designers, performance engineers, Air traffic controllers and various Subject Matter experts)
Interface with the customer (requires international travel)
Ensure that the NAVBLUE product related processes are used during project delivery
Be the first point of contact for customer
Organize and/or participate and/or deliver presentations to the customer.
Collect and provide to the Product Manager feedback on project implementation (lessons learnt) and propose continuous improvement of his/her product (process, methodology, templates used )
Collect and provide to the Sales and Marketing team feedback on project implementation vs. contract
Projects ranging from 50 k€ up to 5M€.
Manage several projects per year




Required skills :
As the successful candidate, you should be able to demonstrate the following skills and competencies:

Education:
Master’s Degree in aeronautical engineering or equivalent
Experience:
Aeronautical background with a minimum of 5 years of experience in the commercial aviation industry and/or Air Traffic Management domain and/or flight operations.

Required Skills/Experience:
Experience in project management (Stakeholders and suppliers management, Risk and cost management as well as project governance)
Knowledge of navigation systems or aircraft performance is a plus (aircraft or helicopters of any manufacturer)
Advanced verbal and written communication skills (Strong coordination and relational skills needed to deal with customers and authorities)
Customer service oriented.
Entrepreneurial & business minded
Ability to work within a small and reactive team.
Willingness to work with flexible schedule including travel.
Proactive in developing understanding of technical subjects.
Team Spirit
Excellent organisation skills
Negotiation level in English

This role will involve some travel for business and as such you must be able to travel accordingly.

Description of the job :
Are you experienced in software development techniques? Are you passionate about designing new solutions for IT products? Come join us at Airbus, in Toulouse-Blagnac, and contribute to our customer delivery as Head of IT Financial Management.

In this role, you will be responsible for setting up, leading and executing IT financial management products & services within the Financial Solutions department at Airbus.

You will be part of a newly created function, in which you will explore, implement and learn how to apply new technologies for the entire IM community!

Task & accountabilities :
As Product manager for IT Financial Management, you will be introducing IM Operational Management and Technology Business Management (TCO) methods for all IM products & services in line with IM transformation and IM Operating Model. You will lead the move from cost to value management and your main tasks and responsibilities will include:

Align IM vision, strategy, objectives on Financial management with Airbus Finance vision, strategy, objectives.
Design, establish and update a 5 year IM Financial Management master plan
Responsible for IM Operational Management – from design to deployment and run,
Responsible for Technology Business Management (TCO views), leading to a holistic view of
IM costs.
Lead the change from cost to value management inside IM, in particular using new methodologies of Value Controlling (Business Case management, Lean & Agile Controlling) and implementing their respective solutions in the given Airbus IM / Finance environment
Advice senior IM management on Finance related topics to support technology choices supporting business goals and objectives.
Being the link between IM management and Finance IM Organisation
Acting as ultimate decision-maker for IT Financial Management, driving committees and reporting to steering committees.
Assure continuity of Services, Efficiency and Speed within the area of IM Financial
Management.
Contribute to optimized supplier base
Contribute to ZIMF objectives and overall ZIMF budget
Recruit, train, and develop department staff
Ensure engagement and satisfaction of internal employees
Provide mentoring and coaching to internal employees
Coordinate internal & external IM Financial Management related communication activities
Contributing to the overall company target to manage Data as an Asset.

This role will involve some travel for business (maximum once a month) in Europe and as such you
must be able to travel accordingly.

Educated to 5 years degree level (or equivalent) in Information Technology or a related discipline
Project management experience (definition and implementation and/or data and architecture set up)
Proven Financial Management experience (Controlling, Accounting)
SAP BW
IT component integration,
Risk base approach, creative and Innovative thinking,
Excellent communication skills with the ability to synthetize complex information and present them,
Team Player and collaborative mindset,

Initial training
Development and upskilling plan
Benefit of working with vibrant and diverse teams

Description of the job :
A vacancy for a Head of Business Development & Partnerships (m/f) has arisen within NAVBLUE in Toulouse.

The jobholder will report to NAVBLUE’s Head of Strategy & Innovation Office (SIO). In the field of airline flight operations, SIO mission is to incubate opportunities from idea to market-tested solutions by maximizing the value creation for both NAVBLUE and its customers
The jobholder will lead the “Business Development & Partnerships” (BD&P) team and be accountable for managing corporate venturing and partnerships to accelerate company profitable growth and to improve competitivity by capturing internal & external flight operations product and services innovation opportunities in line with company strategy
The jobholder manages the Early Adopter Program (EAP) which aims at engaging the customers from the early phases of the innovation development with the goal to better design future products and to turn these customers into advocate
The Head of “Business Development & Partnerships” is a key contributor to establishing the NAVBLUE’s corporate and business strategy by providing strategies to grow in current and new market segments
This role involves some travel and credibly representing the organization internally and externally

Task & accountabilities :
Your main tasks and activities will include:

The jobholder will manage the Business Development & Partnerships team: team organization and governance, goal setting, performance management, hiring & mobilities.
In close coordination with NAVBLUE product lines, legal & procurement functions, the jobholder manages NAVBLUE’s corporate partnerships (external & within Airbus Group)
Working with cross-functional teams, the jobholder assesses new partnerships opportunities and leads competitive analyses, to develop in-depth ad-hoc understanding of technologies, business models, global markets and competitive landscapes
The jobholder manages new partnerships deal due diligence processes through cross-functional teamwork, including financial modelling, process planning and execution for licensing, partnering and potential M&A opportunities
The jobholder leads the business plan preparation, including business modelling and business case, for new product and services opportunities in close cooperation with SIO Product Development & Innovation team and other NAVBLUE stakeholders
The jobholder leads the Early Adopter Program in close coordination with other NAVBLUE stakeholders (marketing, sales, product lines, legal)
The jobholder will represent the organization in internal & external forums/events and support marketing actions from a business perspective

OUTPUTS:
o Identify & assess new partnerships opportunities in close relationships with NAVBLUE functions and relevant Airbus organizations
o Develop quality relationships with managers and decision makers of current NAVBLUE partners (internal & external to Airbus Group)
o Maintain a Partnerships Development dashboard for the Executive Team
o Establish value proposition, business model and business case for new product and services opportunities to support board decisions
o Manage the pool of Early Adopter Program airlines and set up the associated contractual agreements in line with new product development roadmaps
o Elaborate synthetic dossiers for the Executive Team and the Board of Directors
o Provide the business content of communication kit
o Set goals, objectives & ways of working for the BD&P team

Required skills :
As the successful candidate, you should be able to demonstrate the following skills and competencies:


Education:
Degree in Business or a similar discipline from an accredited post-secondary institution
Experience:
5 to 10 years’ experience (or more) in Marketing, Sales or Business Development roles

Knowledge, Skills, Demonstrated Capabilities & Competencies:
Excellent commercial and business knowledge as well as technical expertise with a strong ability to understand customers’ and business partners’ needs and demands
Entrepreneurial mindset with excellent analytical and problem-solving skills: Business goals/achievements, result oriented, strategic vision, customer focus and perseverance with passion to win
Strong ability to work in a team and act as a leader, showing aptitude to innovate and lead change. Strong ability to adapt in a dynamic, ever changing environment
Understanding of Airbus network

Communication Skills (Spoken, Written, Influencing, Proficiency in Other Languages):
Strong interpersonal, communication and negotiation skills with aptitude in building relationships with professionals of all organizational levels
Business Advanced level in English

Technical Systems Proficiency:
Experience in Airline Services or Flight Ops challenges in the aerospace industry
Interest in new digital technologies, trend setters, big data. Knowledge or experience in LEAN start-up, Design Thinking and Agile methodologies would be a plus

Travel Required:
Willingness to travel: ~10% Domestic and International

description:
Airbus Operations SAS
Airbus is a global leader in aeronautics, space and related services. In 2018 it generated revenues of € 64 billion and employed a workforce of around 134,000. Airbus offers the most comprehensive range of passenger airliners. Airbus is also a European leader providing tanker, combat, transport and mission aircraft, as well as one of the world's leading space companies. In helicopters, Airbus provides the most efficient civil and military rotorcraft solutions worldwide.

Our people work with passion and determination to make the world a more connected, safer and smarter place. Taking pride in our work, we draw on each other's expertise and experience to achieve excellence. Our diversity and teamwork culture propel us to accomplish the extraordinary - on the ground, in the sky and in space.
Job Description
Contact :
Please apply for this vacancy online at our careers site (www.jobs.airbus.com) with your CV and a cover letter in English attached. By submitting your application you are consenting to Airbus Group using and storing information about you for monitoring purposes relating to your application or future employment. This information will only be used by Airbus Group.
#ZIS

Description of the job :
A vacancy for a Senior SOC Analyst in Airbus Cyber security Defence Center (m/f) has arisen.
You will join the Cyber Security Department.
About Cyber Security is Airbus:
Security is not an option, be part of it !
Today, governments, companies and private individuals are increasingly the target of attacks like theft
of intellectual property, sensitive information and even money.
Last year Norton Cybercrime Report estimated a global cost of cybercrime around 150 billion Euros.
Airbus Group is more and more at risk due to its leading position in the market and the additional risks
coming from the Extended Enterprise. We have been facing malware attacks which have become
more and more sophisticated over the last months.
IT Security measures can do a lot, but each of us, as Airbus employees, are the first line of defence.
What is doing the Cyber Security Defence Center team:
Security threats have increased drastically in the last few years and organization are facing an
increasingly complex threat landscape. Airbus digitalization is bringing many opportunities but they
come with new risks. Therefore, Airbus has developed state-of-the art cyber-threats detection
capabilities, relying on more than 10 years of experience, in order to protect its business
assets.

Task & accountabilities :
The SOC Mission :
Monitoring , detection , and analysis of potential intrusions in real time and through historical
trending on security-relevant data sources
Response to confirmed incidents, by directing use of timely and appropriate countermeasures
Providing situational awareness and reporting on cybersecurity status, incidents .

Your role:
You will be a part of the transnational peer group of 4 (France, UK, Germany, Spain) Country Security
Officers with a direct link with all the others sites around the world (US, China, India, Russia, Middle
East ...).
The jobholder will support the Cyber Security department by providing operational platform and tools
that follow best practices to ensure adherence to IM standard. He will work with a wide variety of
people from different internal organizational units, bringing them together to manifest controls that
reflect workable compromises as well as proactive responses to current and future information
security risks.
We are looking for motivated people with at least 3 years of experience in cybersecurity, able to
quickly understand and supervise complex systems, processes and programs .
For this position, a high level of autonomy and pragmatic is required.
You are based in Toulouse and report to the SOC Product Manager.

Tasks & Accountabilities:

The jobholder is accountable to design, implement, integrate measures to detect and responds Cyber
Threats (ie. Advanced Persistent Threats, fraud) against Airbus to reduce company risks. He/she will
be integrated into Security Operations Center team (SOC).
The main tasks are :
# Define SOC framework and processes to efficiently measure company risks
# Design, measure and improve SOC detections and ensure its consistency/efficiency
# Measure risk reduction and quality of service provided by SOC
# Analyze, qualify and respond to cyber security incidents and conduct investigations
# Build new tools and techniques to compress human-intensive tasks
# Strong intuition and ability to think “outside the box”
# Analyze/Crunch data to improve SOC detections strategy
# Keep up to date with threats in the wild to ensure level of detection is appropriated
# Guarantee the availability and the performance of the solution, despite huge volumes of data
# Be accountable for platform maintenance and upgrade
# Propose and lead improvements to offer a better service (continuous improvement in terms of
architecture, network quality and processes)
# Identify system misconfigurations and work with system owners to correct them
# Anticipate needs and further evolutions (global vision and strategic survey), define the
strategy, the roadmap and manage the implementation for his/her domain of competency,
# Ensure the reporting for his activity to high level Airbus Management.

Required skills :
# A Master degree in Information and Technology and additional related experience
# An ability to understand technical details and communicate the essentials at a high level is
essential,
# An MSc Information Security would be desirable but is not essential Certification
# Information Security and/or Information Technology industry certification (CISSP, CISM, or
equivalent) preferred but not essential
# Experience in Information Security field (One of these: Windows, Network, Unix/Linux)
# IT related certifications are beneficial (Linux, Microsoft, G-Suite, AWS, Splunk)
# Experience in data systems architecture preferred.
# Cross cultural sensitivity, flexibility
# Experience in Agile, SAFE & Scrum methodology preferred but not essential
# Organized with a proven ability to prioritize workload, meet deadlines, and utilize time
effectively
# Good interpersonal and communication skills, works effectively as a team player
# Good analytical skills
# Fluent in English
# Knowledge and experience in SPLUNK Enterprise Security (any certification appreciated)
# Good knowledge in log management, Splunk application and search development (SPL),
SOAR technology (Splunk Phantom)
# Good knowledge development in python would be preferred but not essential
# Experience in clustered Enterprise SPLUNK environment
# Knowledge in SOC referentials such as Sigma, Stix Taxii, MITRE ATT&CK

Aerospace Sales Account Manager

Êtes-vous motivé par les défis ? Passionné par les nouvelles technologies ? Créatif avec le goût du challenge ? Si vous êtes intéressé par une carrière où l'innovation est un état d'esprit, rejoignez Altair.
Altair peut être décrit comme "entrepreneurial", avec un focus sur l'innovation. Nous sommes fiers de dire que nous aimons travailler ensemble et que nous collaborons avec nos clients du monde entier. Le talent et les idées ont de la valeur chez Altair. La communication est ouverte et le travail d'équipe est encouragé.
Chez Altair, nous vous proposons une carrière pleine d’opportunités. Altair est à la recherche de professionnels jeunes, dynamiques et ambitieux, désireux de se surpasser, qui veulent sortir des sentiers battus et qui sont prêts à relever des défis.
Pour nous accompagner dans notre croissance, nous recherchons de nouveaux talents, et notamment notre futur(e) Aerospace Sales Account Manager. Rattaché(e) au directeur Aéronautique & Défense, vous serez en charge de la vente et la promotion de la suite HyperWorks et des services associés.

Quel sera votre rôle ?
Prospecter, suivre et développer les comptes dont vous aurez la charge pour générer du chiffre d’affaires
Identifier et comprendre les besoins et les enjeux des acteurs industriels
Gérer des cycles de vente complexes et assurer la coordination en lien avec le service marketing, commercial et support technique afin de proposer des solutions adaptées et à forte valeur ajoutée pour nos clients
Démontrer les valeurs de la solution d’Altair en rencontrant régulièrement vos clients pour évaluer leur satisfaction et leurs besoins sur les solutions d’Altair et proposer des solutions/service adaptés
Réaliser de la veille concurrentielle sur votre secteur

Ce poste est-il fait pour vous ?
Vous avez une expérience minimum de 2 ans dans la vente de solutions complexes sur un secteur d’activité similaire ou vous avez une formation universitaire / école d’ingénieur avec une expérience en ingénierie mécanique où vous aspirez à évoluer vers un poste de vente
Vous avez une expérience dans le domaine industriel aéronautique et défense
Capacité à s’appuyer sur les compétences et les connaissances des équipes technique et commerciale
Excellent relationnel, capacité d'écoute et d'analyse pour prioriser les actions dans un environnement concurrentiel
Fort intérêt pour le Web et les médias sociaux professionnels et les outils de vente
Excellentes compétences en communication : oral, écrit et présentation
Bonne compréhension des technologies d’ingénierie
Anglais courant, à l’oral comme à l’écrit
Le poste est à pourvoir ASAP et peut être basé sur Toulouse (31) ou sur Antony (92).

Nous vous offrons :
Salaire fixe + variable
Voiture de fonction
PC, portable
Titres restaurants
Plan d’Epargne Entreprise

Ce qu’Altair peut vous apporter :
Vous pourrez évoluer dans un environnement international au travers de nos 71 bureaux répartis dans 24 pays (France, Etats-Unis, Espagne, Italie, Angleterre, Allemagne, Chine, Japon, Inde, Afrique du Sud,…) dans un environnement de travail flexible et dynamique
Vous ferez grandir vos compétences en élargissant vos responsabilités adaptées à vos envies et à vos ambitions. Votre autonomie et votre dynamisme seront des atouts nécessaires pour réussir au sein de notre structure jeune et réactive
Vous travaillerez dans un environnement stimulant, propice à l’initiative et d’experts techniques passionnés qui se soutiennent mutuellement. Chez Altair, nous vous proposons bien plus qu’une carrière pleine d’opportunités. Nous vous invitons à faire partie d’une communauté scientifique et technique dont les maitre-mots sont : l’innovation, la technologie et la diversité

A propos d’Altair :
Altair Engineering France (AEF) est une filiale d'Altair Engineering Inc, côtée au Nasdaq (ALT), société technologique mondiale qui fournit des solutions logicielles et de cloud computing dans les domaines du développement de produits, du calcul haute performance (HPC) et du data intelligence. Altair permet aux entreprises de tous les secteurs de l'industrie d'être plus compétitives dans un monde connecté tout en créant un avenir plus durable. Avec plus de 2 000 employés, Altair Engineering Inc. a son siège social à Troy, Michigan, USA et possède 71 bureaux dans 24 pays.
Altair HyperWorks est une plate-forme logicielle de simulation pour l'ingénierie assistée par ordinateur (IAO) qui permet aux entreprises de créer des produits de qualité supérieure, leaders de leur marché, de manière innovante et efficace.
Altair HyperWorks fournit la solution IAO la plus complète et ouverte de son marché, et comprends les meilleures solutions de modélisation, d'analyse, de visualisation et de gestion de données pour les applications de calcul linéaire, non linéaire, d'optimisation structurelle, d'interaction fluide-structure et de dynamique multi-corps. Altair HyperWorks continue de dominer le marché avec son interopérabilité et son ouverture unique avec les solutions commerciales de CAO et CAE du PLM.
Pour en savoir plus : www.altair.com

Présent dans 140 pays, l'engagement et le savoir-faire des femmes et des hommes font du Groupe Bureau Veritas, un des leaders mondiaux de l'évaluation de la conformité et de la certification en matière de qualité, hygiène/santé, sécurité, environnement et responsabilité sociale (QHSE). Rejoignez l'excellence technique et innovante de nos équipes pour appartenir à un groupe reconnu depuis plus de 180 ans pour sa qualité de service et son engagement éthique pour le développement durable.
Mission

Le Chef de Projet Sécurité aérienne travaillera de manière rapprochée avec le Chef de service « Aviation Safety » afin de
Promouvoir et mettre en œuvre les initiatives de digitalisation au sein de l'Agence ainsi que le développement des nouveaux services associés


Basé à Toulouse, le Chef de projet sécurité aérienne voyagera très fréquemment à l'international afin de réaliser les missions d'assistance dans le domaine de la sécurité aérienne qui lui seront confiées, au sein de compagnie aérienne au d'autorité de l'aviation civile, mais également afin de promouvoir les services de l'Agence Aéronautique.

Les responsabilités du poste comprennent :
Le développement commercial des services de l'Agence Aéronautique et Espace via le déploiement de la stratégie définie et la définition de plan d'actions associés
La promotion des initiatives digitales au sein de l'Agence
Assurer le support du Chef de service Aviation Safety dans le cadre de la définition de nouveaux services ainsi que de la gestion financière
Assurer la gestion de projet d'assistance dans le domaine de la sécurité aérienne en coordination avec une équipe d'experts
Assurer la veille des évolutions et développements en matière de Sécurité aérienne


Profil recherché

De formation Minimum Bac+5 dans le domaine aéronautique, vous disposez d'une expérience professionnelle de 5 années minimum dans le domaine de la Sécurité Aérienne acquise au sein de Compagnies Aériennes, d'Organisme d'Entretien, d'Autorités de l'Aviation Civile ou d'entreprises de conseil.
Une expérience dans le domaine de la digitalisation est nécessaire.
Une expérience de management ou de gestion de projet est nécessaire (minimum 5 ans).
Une expérience avérée dans la gestion du développement centre budgétaire est nécessaire (croissance, budget revenue, etc .)
Un anglais courant à l'écrit et à l'oral est impératif pour le poste ainsi que d'excellentes capacités de communication et de rédaction et une forte capacité d'adaptation.



Since 1922, Bureau Veritas has been a key player in aviation, considered as the aviation safety and security regulation specialist. Bureau Veritas Aeronautics & Space Agency offers a wide range of consulting, training and auditing services for aviation stakeholders including: Original Equipment Manufacturer (OEM), Airline, Maintenance Repair Organization (MRO), Airport, Air Navigation Services Provider (ANSP) and Aviation Authorities.
In close coordination with the Head of Aviation Safety, the Aviation Safety Project Manager will effectively support the business strategic development, commercial leadership and support Head of Aviation Safety for management of daily activities of the Aviation Safety Business Unit. In addition, role of the Aviation Safety Project Manager is to promote and implement digital initiatives within the Aviation Safety Business Unit.

YOUR ROLE :

In close coordination with the Head of Aviation Safety, the Aviation Safety Project Manager will effectively support the business strategic development, commercial leadership and support Head of Aviation Safety for management of daily activities of the Aviation Safety Business Unit. In addition, role of the Aviation Safety Project Manager is to promote and implement digital initiatives within the Aviation Safety Business Unit.

You will develop and implement the Bureau Veritas aviation safety commercial strategy and business expansion, identifying new opportunities for development in the global market to support operational growth.

With a base in the Toulouse Head Office you will represent Bureau Veritas worldwide for all topics related to aviation safety enhancing the company image though maintaining high quality services whist meeting financial and legal obligations.

Your key accountabilities will include the following:
Develop Bureau Veritas aviation safety business expansion and commercial strategy and ensure alignment with Bureau Veritas Aeronautics & Space Agency overall strategy
Create business opportunities such as commercial and expansion plans to support Bureau Veritas Aeronautics & Space strategic expansion plans
Promote digital initiatives within the Aviation Safety Business Unit
Assist Head of Aviation Safety for the preparation and consolidation of the Business Unit budget including new products, commercial projects and revenue and monitoring financial performance versus the budget
Coordinate implementation of aviation safety projects within the scope of the Business Unit
Keep abreast of any market trends and developments relating to aviation safety


Qualifications and Skills

University degree in engineering or a related subject, or significant experience in the area of aviation consultancy
Formal training in civil aviation management and/or aviation safety
Experience in digitalization projects, big data and blockchain
Minimum of 5 years of relevant experience in an Airline / Civil Aviation Authority / MRO / Airport at a management position
Proven track record of business growth, managing revenue, forecast and budgets for an international organization
Minimum of 5 years relevant experience in managing major projects and contracts involving external consultants
High level of computer literacy with proficiency in MS Office and MS project
Excellent oral and written communication skills with the ability to write reports in English and French, knowledge of another language would be an advantage
Willingness to undertake international travel
Ability to work well in cross-functional and multi-national teams

Description of the job :
A vacancy for a Pre Sales Project Manager (m/f) has arisen within Airbus Defence & Space (Intelligence) in Toulouse. As the successful candidate, you will join the Ground Segment, IMINT and GEOINT Programmes (“TCIMI2” department).

In this role, you will provide support to the bid manager during the preparation of the offers. You will work in close cooperation with bid support, have customer interface. .

The Geospatial Intelligence market is promising in terms of growth as well as customer expectations for high end products. Our access to the market is boosted by the recent investments made by Airbus Defence and Space in both new satellites (Pleiades Neo) and digital solutions (analytics on big data).

This position will require a security clearance or will require being eligible for clearance by the recognized authorities.

Task & accountabilities :
Your main tasks and responsibilities will include:

Contribute in winning proposals, especially by making consistent and realistic quotation
Write up, in pre-sales phase, optimized program development plan (logic and milestones), taking best benefit of internal thematic resources and partners
Be creative and collect inputs to propose evolutions of our solutions
You will have opportunities to use and develop your network (internal and external) for requirements collection, associated applications/solutions customization, pilot definition and training/support organization.
You will rely on a set of thematic experts, depending on the related area (ex: Image Intelligence, Geo-Intelligence Open Source, Intelligence, Mapping...)

Depending on the size of the pre-sales case, you will be responsible for
Managing a multi-functional team (including Engineering, Procurement, IVQ functions, services)
Providing inputs to the Monthly Review, Business Reviews and other Airbus Defence and Space relevant reviews and in line with the agreed methods and principles.
when the bid is awarded, making a proper hand over to the project manager.

From time to time and depending on the case, you will be nominate project manager after the bid is awarded.

Required skills :
You will have the following skills and experience:

Educated to an engineering degree level or equivalent.
Proven experience in project management with pre-sales aspects.
Experience in supporting bid teams, on customised products.
Space or geospatial experience.
Strong interpersonal and communication skills.
Reactivity.
Negotiation level of French.
At least an advanced level of English.

Description of the job :
This role is to support the Cyber Transformation Program and relevant Cyber teams to deliver a number of immediate risk priorities and key artefacts. This role is responsible for:

Using the cyber risk framework to facilitate the process and develop the output for risk identification, risk remediation, risk monitoring and risk reporting with the risk owners and relevant teams
Using the cyber capability model to identify the critical capabilities for risk prevention and risk mitigation
Testing the cyber control maturity using defined criteria and processes
Demonstrating risk movement as a result of capability uplift as well as changing threat landscape
Identifying opportunities for continuous improvement in risk reduction and capability uplift

Task & accountabilities :
1. Establish a clear understanding of the risk and controls environment and how that has an impact on the delivery of key initiatives
2. Gather, organize, synthesize large amounts of data from various sources and translate it to business information in Excel, Word and PowerPoint
3. Develop new initiative or refine existing initiatives based on risk profile needs, business requirements and constraints
4. Contribute to risk data improvements through data analytics and consultation with the stakeholders so that data quality is improved
5. Ensure risk treatments are implemented in an effective and timely manner by supporting risk improvement artefacts development
6. Review and update of risk-related policies as required
7. Conduct Key Risk Indicator reporting activities in line with program timelines
8. Other risk and compliance related activities as required
9. Stakeholder engagements, working with multiple teams in multiple locations

Required skills :
You have a university degree, cyber knowledge preferable
You understand relevant industry standards and frameworks ISO, NIST, COBIT
You have several years of work experience in Information Management or in Airbus
You have advanced analytics skills and can process large quantity of structured / unstructured data
You have excellent communication (verbal and non-verbal) and presentation skills, as well as a keen interest in continuous improvement and digital activities
You have risk and compliance experience

Description of the job :
A vacancy for a Head of Airspace & Airport Solutions (m/f) has arisen within NAVBLUE in Toulouse.

NAVBLUE is a wholly owned subsidiary dedicated to the development of value added flight operations services for Airlines, ANSPs, Airports and other OEMs.
The Head of Airspace and Airport Solutions reports to the VP Ground Solutions.
He/She is accountable for:
Global P&L management and operational objectives
Manage 3 Business Lines (Airspace Design Solutions, Airport Solutions, GNSS Solutions)
Ensure business growth in close cooperation with marketing and sales and developing the portfolio of product and services both organically and via partnership with SIO
Represent Navblue at industry leading conferences supporting the position of a worldwide leader in this business
Managing the interfaces with Airbus Engineering (E), Safety (GS), Programs (B) and Customer Services (S)

You will have to manage a team (around 30 people).

The jobholder manages the full Profit and Loss responsibility for product and services coordinating with marketing and sales ensuring proper commercial follow-up securing the resources necessary to the execution.

The jobholder leads and develops the Airspace & Airport team:
encompassing business analysts, project managers, designers, experts and engineers
in Navblue offices and deployed at Airbus sites (Biejing, Miami...)

The jobholder manages the development of software products in close cooperation with Airbus CTO and sub-contractors.

The jobholder organizes the lobbying of worldwide aviation institutions, airworthiness authorities in order to position Navblue as a leader in global ATM optimization.

The jobholder ensures the coordination of the key stakeholders either internal (S, C, B, E, G) or external (Avionics Suppliers, Airports, ANSPs ...).

Support Innovation and Business Development to grow the business

Experience working with the assigned product at any of the following:
# Airframe manufacturer

# Aviation software provider

# Aviation industry association
Experience in the aviation industry is required minimum eight years of relevant experience, including in-depth knowledge of aviation software products and services
In-depth understanding of Air Traffic Management at large
Managerial experience is required and international / multi-cultural would be a plus.
Global B2B marketing experience desired
Ability to influence and communicate at multiple levels both internally and externally
Professional and collaborative approach to interacting with colleagues and customers superior interpersonal and decision-making skills to resolve critical or contentious issues.
Strong team orientation to provide necessary leadership in the multiple interactive environments the position demands
Understanding of the software development process
Experience with enterprise solutions in large customer bases
Willingness to travel Internationally
Results-oriented, innovative, and a strong problem solver
Fluent in English both written and spoken
